story:
Why Housing Assistance matters to Veronica's kids

I'm Veronica's former neighbor and close friend, and I know how important it is that she and her children keep their rent assistance 

  • to stay together as a family under one roof
  • to keep a solid home base for school
  • to avoid the heartbreak of losing their belongings

Veronica's housing assistance pays most of their monthly rent right now, and it caps her rent at 30% of her income.  Without it, she and her kids will lose their current home.  And they have only about a week to come up with the money to keep it.

The family shelter in St. Paul is a day shelter where families are bussed at 5 pm to churches to sleep.  Let's all pitch in now to keep Serenity, Butta, Juicy, Jawon, Ariah and Johny from being the kids on that bus.

What we can do

Only $500 will settle Veronica's differences with her former landlord and prevent an "eviction" strike from ending her housing assistance.  If everyone who cares pitches in just a little bit, we can help them over this hurdle.

Your small contribution now will be multiplied each time the rent gets paid--this month, next month, and for many months to come.  It will matter every time the family uses their home as a base for success in school and work.  

Any funds contributed will go directly to Veronica's settlement with her old landlord.

Anything leftover will go directly to the family.  It will buy an affordable family swim pass or pay for a good fan for their second story duplex.  However generous or humble, your gift will keep on giving all summer long and into the future.

Like the kids in the 60 minutes video link attached, Veronica's kids have suffered a lot from scarcity. This campaign can show them that they're not in this struggle alone.  They're surrounded by people who care, who believe in them, and who know they deserve a safe, stable home.

Joining hands was never easier

Indiegogo, Facebook, and Twitter make lending a hand and combining small contributions easier than ever before.  Putting out a small fire now often prevents a disaster later.  

We can pick up these tools and use them when people we know and love are facing a housing crisis.  We can take a stand against poverty instead of turning our heads away from the growing number of kids living with less.

Consider it "volunteer firefighting" against a different sort of threat to a family home.

 

Please spread the word

Every little bit helps.  Through this campaign, we'll add whatever you can afford to whatever the rest of us can afford until we have enough money to make a difference.  Even if you have no cash to spare right now, you can still share the love, spread the word, and help the cause.

Post this campaign on Facebook and twitter--wherever you can.  Add your messages of hope to Veronica and her whole family.  Give them something to celebrate this fourth of July.  

Let the kids know you care!

story:
We believe in change for the greater good.

In fact it’s our mission. LeadLocal builds the Tucson community through leadership programs and in-kind consulting projects that connect tomorrow’s leaders with our business & non-profit communities. We make a difference today to make a difference tomorrow.

A year ago, we started with a dream to make Tucson a better place by providing the type of hands-on coaching we heard young people asking for; by helping our startup, small business, and nonprofit communities through in-kind business consulting;and by making a measurable impact.  

This Spring, LeadLocal's 16 undergraduate interns and 4 young professionals came together to be the change and make a difference for two local non-profits.

We are proud of the difference we've made, contributing more than 2,300 hours and $25,000 of in-kind consulting.  

LeadLocal makes a difference.

You can make a difference.

Your support means that LeadLocal will have the resources necessary to grow, and we can't do this without you. Our goal is to raise $10,500. Your investment makes a real impact. Your contributions will be used to...

  • support our corporate immersion summer program for high school students;
  • engage in further partnerships with Downtown Tucson Partnership, Gangplank, and others making a difference in our community;
  • promote LeadLocal's efforts through outreach and marketing. 

The community needs us, and we need you!

Together, we can create a vibrant network of young leaders with the drive, enthusiasm, and skills our community needs.

story:
Campaign Background

Bullying is a choice. The power to choose is yours. We believe that the key to ending bullying lies in the moment when you make that choice. We want to empower kids to make better choices. The "I Choose" Anti-Bullying Campaign is a youth-inspired movement that challenges people to stop, think and remember that their choices matter.

“I Choose” is the first education initiative of our nonprofit, The Yoursphere Media Foundation and Coalition for Internet Safety Education and Reform 501(c)(3). When we created it in March 2012, we knew we had to design a solution that went beyond addressing bullying at the surface; the solution needed to tackle the issue at its roots. But the solution also needed to be simple enough for young children to understand.

We started asking questions like, what would happen if kids, at that pivotal moment, chose to show compassion instead of being cruel? How could we remind kids that this moment counts, that it can shape their life and the lives of the people around them? So, with the help from some really awesome kids and teens who said that the choices they make are the key to ending bullying, together, we came up with five powerful social concepts that kids can choose as a counteraction to bullying: friendship, kindness, respect, compassion and love. To bring this all to fruition, we created a website for the campaign where people can learn more about our mission, declare their choice and share their own bullying story with the public.

What We Need & What You Get

On our own, we've been able to bring the "I Choose" Challenge into schools all over the country. Today, the program is in more than 300 schools in the U.S. and ten countries around the world. Due to a lack of funding, however, we can no longer keep up with the demand. Educators from all around the world are requesting the program, and the list just keeps growing. That's where your donations come in. Every penny we receive will go directly to funding the materials and shipping costs to get the "I Choose" Classroom Challenge into the schools that need them.

Perks

For donating $10 you get an “I Choose” bracelet of your choice. 

For donating $25 you get an “I Choose” bracelet of your choice and an announcement of your support on our Facebook and Twitter accounts.

For donating $100 you get everything in Perk 2, and we will add your name to the Supporters page on our campaign’s website.

The Impact

Here's a breakdown of how your contributions can help hundreds or thousands of students across the country:

  • $150 will get our anti-bullying program into 10 schools or youth groups
  • $750, 50 schools or youth groups
  • $1,500, 100 schools or youth groups
  • $7,500, 500 schools or youth groups
  • $15,000, 1000 schools or youth groups

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about the campaign! Liking us on Facebook or following us on Twitter is a great way to show your support, and means a great deal to our team.
  • Join the “I Choose” movement by visiting us at whatdoyouchoose.org, making your choice and getting your “I Choose” bracelet.
  • You can also read stories that bullying victims from all over the country have submitted, and share your own.

To bring this all to fruition, we created a website for the campaign where people can learn more about our mission, declare their choice and share their own bullying story with the public.
What We Need & What You Get
On our own, we've been able to bring the "I Choose" Challenge into schools all over the country. Today, the program is in more than 300 schools in the U.S. and ten countries around the world. Due to a lack of funding, however, we can no longer keep up with the demand. Educators from all around the world are requesting the program, and the list just keeps growing. That's where your donations come in. Every penny we receive will go directly to funding the materials and shipping costs to get the "I Choose" Classroom Challenge into the schools that need them.
Perks
For donating $10 you get an “I Choose” bracelet of your choice. For donating $25 you get an “I Choose” bracelet of your choice and an announcement of your support on our Facebook and Twitter accounts.For donating $100 you get everything in Perk 2, and we will add your name to the Supporters page on our campaign’s website.
The Impact
Here's a breakdown of how your contributions can help hundreds or thousands of students across the country:

$150 will get our anti-bullying program into 10 schools or youth groups
$750, 50 schools or youth groups
$1,500, 100 schools or youth groups
$7,500, 500 schools or youth groups
$15,000, 1000 schools or youth groups
Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about the campaign! Liking us on Facebook or following us on Twitter is a great way to show your support, and means a great deal to our team.

Join the “I Choose” movement by visiting us at whatdoyouchoose.org, making your choice and getting your “I Choose” bracelet.

You can also read stories that bullying victims from all over the country have submitted, and share your own.

story:
OUR STORY

We saw the research…

1 in 4: That’s the number of women who will experience domestic abuse in her lifetime. We were surprised.

We heard the statistic…

3: That’s the daily tally of women killed by their husbands or boyfriends. We were appalled.

We were told…

1,500 times: That’s how much more likely a child is to suffer domestic abuse when an adult in the home is being abused.

We were saddened, which inspired us to act, which brought us here, to IndieGoGo.

The violence—in all forms—must stop. That is why we, Women In Film & Television Atlanta (WIFTA), have decided to launch a public service campaign (PSA) against violence. For the first PSA in the campaign, we’ve committed to creating an anti domestic violence PSA and have selected Partnership Against Domestic Violence (PADV) as our partner in this endeavor. In the future, with your support, we hope to produce additional PSAs. However, this is where it all begins. By creating this anti domestic violence PSA, we are taking our first step forward in being the change we wish to see in the world; by donating today, you will be taking a step with us.

IMPACT

The overarching theme of the anti violence campaign is “Peace Begins At Home.” The concept will be the basis of each PSA we produce. For this fist PSA, the anti domestic violence PSA, we will focus on the effect that domestic violence has on the victims and witnesses of domestic violence as well as others in society who encounter the witnesses later in life. The PSA will launch in October 2011, which is Domestic Violence Awareness Month.

Since PADV is our direct partner for this particular PSA, we will share the PSA with them for use on the PADV.org Web site. However, we expect our reach for this PSA, and others in the “Peace Begins At Home” series, to go well beyond that. We will make each PSA available to organizations with similar anti violence interests, local and national broadcast television stations and various Internet outlets. We also plan to expand the campaigns into other media—print ads, posters, etc.—as money and opportunities permit. Once people embrace the concept that peace does truly begin at home, it will be a seed that will grow in homes throughout America, positively affecting society for generations.

 

WHAT WE NEED

First and foremost, we need you. The funding goal we’ve set is the minimum we need to produce the anti domestic violence PSA. Without your help, this first PSA in our series, nor subsequent PSAs, will be possible.

Since we are WIFTA, we have the talent within our organization to produce the “Peace Begins At Home” PSAs. Our members have agreed to donate (ie. they’re not charging us!) their time and expertise to work as crew for the anti domestic violence PSA. That’s a huge cost—upwards of $5,000 in itself—that we will not incur! What we cannot escape, however, are costs for equipment, actors, studio / location fees, props, general supplies, production insurance, editing and post-production sound as well as communications with television stations, Internet outlets and other anti-domestic abuse organizations of the PSA’s availability for their use / distribution. Again, PADV will not incur any costs whatsoever; our work on this PSA is our community service gift to PADV.

WIFTA is a registered 501(c) 3 nonprofit organization. As such, all events and projects we are able to do are based on support from donations. For each PSA we hope to launch, we will need funding. This is why your donation, which may be tax deductible, and assistance in informing others of our plight is critical. We cannot do this alone.

***NOTE: If you are company or organization that wishes to sponsor any portion of the production through in-kind donations or to become a general sponsor of the PSA in an amount of $500+, please contact us directly regarding cross-promotional opportunities.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Part of the reason why violence is so prevalent and viral is because people ignore it, they feel that their efforts to stop it won’t matter or they’re too scared to act; some even think that if the violence isn’t happening to them, it doesn’t effect and affect them. They’re wrong. Violence impacts us all. So, here are four ways that you can help us in this battle against violence:

1.      Make a donation so we can produce the first anti violence PSA!

2.      Share this page on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc. and ask people to donate whatever they can as well.

3.      If it’s not already there, create peace in your home and start talking about domestic violence. Remember: 1 in 4 women experience domestic violence. Is it someone you know? Are their children being abused too…or could they be? Start the dialogue.

4.      Bookmark this page to get project updates. Plus, we will need your continued support to complete the PSA series.

“Peace Begins At Home.” You can make that notion a reality. Your donation, regardless of size, will make a difference.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Angela Congrove, and I’m a student at The University of Iowa. This summer I am planning on participating in a Japanese language program called APU Gateway Summer Program at Ritsumeikan Asia Pacific University in Beppu, Oita, Japan. It has been my goal this past year to participate in a summer program to study Japanese, but my dreams are in danger of being out of reach.

I’ve done all I can do to prepare, and it seems the hand of fate has delt me a difficult card. Although I’ve paid my program fees, the departure date is approaching faster than I can receive my financial aid to purchase plane tickets. I depart on May 31st, however my financial aid is coming too close to the date to afford a decently priced ticket. On top of the ticket price, I need finances to insure that I will be able to feed and take care of myself while abroad. Any money that is contributed will be put towards my plane tickets and my immediate needs in Japan.

Last fall I transferred to The University of Iowa, where it was necessary for me to retake 2nd year Japanese. I’m near the end of the course now, and it has been worth it, but I have a strong feeling of being behind where I need to be. This summer course is valuable to me, and I would be very disappointed if I had to miss out because of a money issue. It’s because of my aspirations to become fluent in Japanese that I set up this fund raiser.

What I Need & What You Get

The typical airfare price to Japan ranges from $1500 – $2500. For my case, I will be booking later and the price will be on the higher end. Any money donated will immediately be put towards my airfare. Once I can purchase airfare, I will then use all other money to pay for food and other living expenses.

IndieGoGo takes 2 weeks at most to send money raised to the campaign creator. For this reason, I can only keep this campaign open for ONE WEEK. I wish I could keep it longer, but I simply cannot wait that long to purchase airfare.

To make this worth your while, I am offering to use some of my talents towards the perks on this page. I am skilled in drawing and writing/covering songs, and I wish to create something for you in return for a donation. Please take a look at the perks I am offering on the side of the page.
You can listen to some of my songs here: http://www.soundclick.com/bands/default.cfm?bandID=499116
You can view some of my artwork here: http://musicalgrl1016.deviantart.com/gallery/

If I do not reach my entire goal, I will put all funds raised towards my plane tickets. If I am unable to afford the ticket and end up staying in the States this summer, I will put the money towards my tuition in summer or fall semester classes.

The Impact

It’s my goal to someday contribute to the global community as a translator, interpreter, or English teacher. I’ve been interested in Japanese culture since I was a kid, and I hope to spread the love I have for the country through helping our countries connect through translation.

I’ve always told myself that money doesn’t matter. It’s times like these that I am reminded that money is what makes the world go around. I wish I didn’t have to put a price tag on an education or on an experience, but I do. I sincerely appreciate any donation I receive and I will try my hardest to make this summer count. I will study hard.

ãŒã‚“ã°ã‚Šã¾ã™ï¼

Other ways you can help

If you can't afford to donate, please post this to your Facebook page, twitter, anywhere you can to spread the word! Thank you!

 

Thank you very much for your time and consideration,
Angela Marie Congrove

story:
"These [genetic] resources stand between us and catastrophic starvation on a scale we cannot imagine. In a very real sense, the future of the human race rides on these materials. The line between abundance and disaster is becoming thinner and thinner, and the public is unaware and unconcerned. Must we wait for disaster to be real before we are heard?”

Professor Jack Harlan, plant geneticist

Who We Are

Indigenous Seed Initiative is the intuitive vision of Terance Miller. Terance is a Botanist-Ecological farmer with twenty years of organic sustainable farming experience. He has an extensive background in ecology, sustainability, ecological agriculture, bio-organic farming, seed saving, astronomy, botany, plant morphology, soil microbiology, herb farming, nutrition, anatomy & physiology and therapeutic herb formula design & manufacturing.

Together  with co-founders Ruby Olisemeka, a home, school and community garden  builder and educator; and Tendaji, a Certified Holistic FoodCare  Specialist, Wellness Chef, Eating AstroPsychology Coach and Founder of a wellness ministry-Food As Nutrition are establishing a seed depository and company that places emphasis on collecting wild and pre-heirloom seeds. Our focus is on collecting, preserving and  multiplying the ancient treasures of the past that possess the original  genetic material of edible foods.

We use the term indigenous seed to denote wild, or as close to wild seeds as one can get, this also includes select heirloom and pre-heirloom varieties. 

We also use the term indigenous to embody both the cultural and genetic value of a seed. Seeds are closely tied to the indigenous people of a land, as a source of nutrition, as part of a spiritual system and as a way to bind the collective. We honor and celebrate the power of the indigenous seed and plant.

What we do

  • We search, explore and identify wild, pre-heirloom, and heirloom varieties we believe represent a genetically vigorous seed stock
  • We procure identified seeds and grow it out for seed crop
  • We sell saved seeds to growers, and encourage them to be independent of us and save their own seeds
  • We produce educational material to help growers seed save 

 

Why Indigenous Seeds?

1. Indigenous/Native/Wild seeds provide greater nutritional value than their domesticated or bred varieties

"How do we begin to recoup the losses of essential nutrients? By "eating on the wild side"--choosing present-day fruits and vegetables that come closest to the nutritional bounty of their wild ancestors." Jo Robinson author Eating on the Wild Side 

The following image was taken from a New York times article titled breeding the nutrition out of food. Jo Robinson shows how wild and heirloom varieties of plants pack more nutritional value than their domesticated varieties.

2. A way to maintain genetic diversity:  To keep many modern bred seeds viable over time, they are often back-crossed with wild strains. Why? Contained within the wild strain is the information/genetics for a plant to thrive - wild vigor. Indigenous/native/wild seeds are often progenitors of the many varieties we see today. As we lose the diversity in our seed stock its imperative to maintain the indigenous stock to replenish this diversity. 


3. We want to put the power in your hands through seed saving: Rather than placing a seed in cold storage, with access mainly to plant breeders and institutional researchers. We believe seeds need to be in the hands of growers, growing, living, developing, multiplying and being saved each year; where their benefits can be experienced in real time, and not some future catastrophic time. Collectively we can rebuild the living vault. We encourage seed saving and provide learning opportunities and educational material to support the seed saver.

4. Cultural integrity

 "For us, seed holds a lot of knowledge. When we find the real seed from the elders, then we are able to bring back the original seed. When we bring back the original seed, we bring back all the cycles of life, which are recognized in our traditions. These traditions have held us together as a strong community since the beginning of time." ~Mphatheleni Maukalule, Venda, South Africa

Almost all cultures around the world have a binding relationship with seeds. The native Indians of America call themselves the "people of the corn" and have formed rituals and ceremonies around the planting, harvesting and saving of the corn seed. The Venda people of South Africa consider millet seed the most sacred seed s it connects them to Mupo, the Creation, the source of their lives, since when they were first created. It is an indigenous seed that is used in all of their spiritual ceremonies. Saving and growing indigenous seed is not only restorative for the body and ecology but also beneficial to cultures around the world as well.

The threat to food security is not just from GMO's

There are other ways corporations are affecting our food supply besides through GMO's; the varying ways are through:

Genetic Engineering: GE inhibits seed development of a species which would otherwise pass down its genetic reproductive capability; this considerably compromises its nutritive  substance.The primary tropical fruits (pineapples, bananas, seedless grapes, seedless watermelon, seedless oranges, lemons, and grapefruits) eaten in America  are by-products of Genetic Engineering.

Hybrids are varieties of the same species that are bred/crossed in order to create certain desired characteristics. They are called  F-1. Often times breeding compromises genetic expression, diversity, nutrition and seed saving. It is often unwittingly a process of removing valuable genetic material thus making a plant susceptible to disease and pathogens. However bred plants are more uniform in growth, production and appearance.

Dehybridization occurs when a selected Hybrid offspring (f-1) becomes a stabilized open – pollinated cultivar; selecting the same offspring for 5 or more successive planting seasons in order to create desired characteristics at the compromise of genetic expression, diversity and nutrition. The end result is an open pollinated
hybrid created simply by a process of removing - breeding out valuable genetic
material thus making a plant susceptible to disease and pathogens. Most of the
so-called Heirlooms are actually pseudo-heirlooms created through this
process of Dehybridization.

Mutation Breeding is the process of exposing seeds to chemicals or radiation in order to generate mutants with desirable traits to be bred with other cultivars. Plants created using mutagenesis are sometimes called mutagenic plants or mutagenic seeds. From 1930–2007 more than 2540 mutagenic plant varieties have been released that have been derived either as direct mutants (70%) or from their progeny (30%).. Crop plants account for 75% of released mutagenic species.

Unlike genetically modified crops, which typically involve the insertion of one or two target genes, plants developed via mutagenic processes with random, multiple and unspecific genetic changes have been discussed as a concern but are not prohibited by U.S. or other country organic standards. Somewhat controversially, several organic food and seed companies promote and sell certified organic products that were developed using both chemical and nuclear mutagenesis. Several certified organic brands, whose companies support strict labeling or outright bans on GMO crops, market their use of branded wheat and other varietal strains which were derived from mutagenic processes without any reference to this genetic manipulation!

Plant breeding is in simple terms the process of creating new open pollinated breeds (that are Hybrid in essence). It is an expanding phenomena that will soon replace many true heirloom species; the new age breeders don't recognize the genetic viability of wild and indigenous species and that the older the seed the more ecologically and nutritional viable it is.

What We Need & What You Get!

We are looking for $5300 in funding. To continue purchasing seeds we have identified as wild or as close to wild as we  can get. We are looking for funding to also purchase additional seed saving, seed packaging and seed storing equipment.

In return for your amazing support you get, yes seeds to grow! Indigenous, wild, pre-heirloom and select heirloom seeds to grow and benefit from and so much more!

If we do not reach our goal, we will use the money we do raise, to purchase seed stock to grow out

If your giving enthusiasm helps us exceed our goal, we can pay to have additional help on the farm this year, and purchase additional seeds and equipment.

We can make a difference, one seed saver at a time!

One way to weaken the powers of big agriculture and their systematic encroachment of seed freedom, is to save your own seeds and grow your own food!

We would like for growers to share the responsibility of "preserving the past and planting the future" by acquiring genetically viable seeds and saving those species whose environmental growing conditions are similar to your own.

We encourage growers to acquire only viable seeds so as to eventually negate the growing of mutated species that compromise the genetic and nutritional substance in plants.

We do not encourage the saving of pseudo-heirlooms - present day and recently bred species.

We encourage the study of basic seed saving principles; and through our educational offerings you will obtain such knowledge.

Thou shall not sow thy field with mingled seed  Leviticus 19:19

Spread the word!

If you cant make a contribution please consider spreading the word and the knowledge of this campaign through your social networks. Share, share and share!! And don't forget to share!

Thank you and much gratitude to you all. We can change the disastrous direction agriculture is headed in, it takes one independent grower and seed saver at a time.

Thank you!!

They are called  F-1. Often times breeding compromises genetic expression, diversity, nutrition and seed saving. It is often unwittingly a process of removing valuable genetic material thus making a plant susceptible to disease and pathogens. However bred plants are more uniform in growth, production and appearance.Dehybridization occurs when a selected Hybrid offspring (f-1) becomes a stabilized open – pollinated cultivar; selecting the same offspring for 5 or more successive planting seasons in order to create desired characteristics at the compromise of genetic expression, diversity and nutrition. The end result is an open pollinatedhybrid created simply by a process of removing - breeding out valuable geneticmaterial thus making a plant susceptible to disease and pathogens. Most of theso-called Heirlooms are actually pseudo-heirlooms created through thisprocess of Dehybridization.Mutation Breeding is the process of exposing seeds to chemicals or radiation in order to generate mutants with desirable traits to be bred with other cultivars. Plants created using mutagenesis are sometimes called mutagenic plants or mutagenic seeds. From 1930–2007 more than 2540 mutagenic plant varieties have been released that have been derived either as direct mutants (70%) or from their progeny (30%).. Crop plants account for 75% of released mutagenic species.Unlike genetically modified crops, which typically involve the insertion of one or two target genes, plants developed via mutagenic processes with random, multiple and unspecific genetic changes have been discussed as a concern but are not prohibited by U.S. or other country organic standards. Somewhat controversially, several organic food and seed companies promote and sell certified organic products that were developed using both chemical and nuclear mutagenesis. Several certified organic brands, whose companies support strict labeling or outright bans on GMO crops, market their use of branded wheat and other varietal strains which were derived from mutagenic processes without any reference to this genetic manipulation! Plant breeding is in simple terms the process of creating new open pollinated breeds (that are Hybrid in essence). It is an expanding phenomena that will soon replace many true heirloom  species; the new age breeders don't recognize the genetic  viability of wild and indigenous species and that the older the seed the more ecologically and nutritional viable it is.What We Need & What You Get!We are looking for $5300 in funding. To continue purchasing seeds we have identified as wild or as close to wild as we  can get. We are looking for funding to also purchase additional seed saving, seed packaging and seed storing equipment. In return for your amazing support you get, yes seeds to grow! Indigenous, wild, pre-heirloom and select heirloom seeds to grow and benefit from and so much more!If we do not reach our goal, we will use the money we do raise, to purchase seed stock to grow outIf your giving enthusiasm helps us exceed our goal, we can pay to have additional help on the farm this year, and purchase additional seeds and equipment.We can make a difference, one seed saver at a time!One way to weaken the powers of big agriculture and their systematic encroachment of seed freedom, is to save your own seeds and grow your own food!We would like for growers to share the responsibility of "preserving the past and planting the future" by acquiring genetically viable seeds and saving those species whose environmental growing conditions are similar to your own. We encourage growers to acquire only viable seeds so as to eventually negate the growing of mutated species that compromise the genetic and nutritional substance in plants. We do not encourage the saving of pseudo-heirlooms - present day and recently bred species. We encourage the study of basic seed saving principles; and through our educational offerings you will obtain such knowledge. Thou shall not sow thy field with mingled seed  Leviticus 19:19 Spread the word!If you cant make a contribution please consider spreading the word and the knowledge of this campaign through your social networks. Share, share and share!! And don't forget to share!Thank you and much gratitude to you all. We can change the disastrous direction agriculture is headed in, it takes one independent grower and seed saver at a time. Thank you!!

story:
The Problem: Since reading is often required and youth are limited in time and choice in the classroom because of the demands of high stakes testing, reading has become a source of dread rather than a source of joy for many students in the education system. The challenge is then to foster a culture of engagement and interest in reading for reading’s sake. Further, youth in underserved communities are not often given a space to express their thoughts and develop their unique voices.   

Our Solution: Youth Choice, Youth Voice Book Club 

The summer is seen as a prime time to provide space, books, and the personal attention of a caring adult mentor to help students learn to read for joy and express their voice. Traditionally summer is a time when learning stagnates and students slide back. By creating the foundation for the Youth Choice, Youth Voice Book Club, we can push learning forward and continue critical thought processes through the summer months.

Our vision is a five week summer literacy exploration program for middle school students.  For the purpose of Indiegogo we chose a name for the book group but ultimately the youth will be choosing the final name of the group. We want the group to be completely student driven. The youth will have ownership over the final name, what they read and how active they would like to be in the club. We would engage our present volunteer tutors as Reading Mentors. Our role as adults is to facilitate, not delegate.

The literacy program will provide structured, safe places for students to read as well as weekly community building book discussions over a nourishing meal. Youth will be surrounded by many different types of reading (graphic novels, short stories, slam poetry and zines, oh my!) and given a chance to explore different types of reading.  From this choice and ability to discover, they will be more apt to express how they are feeling and what they are thinking through this process. As an organization we will provide a safe environment for opinion sharing.

At the end of the literacy exploration program students will produce their own book of literature responses and reviews. This book will be bound and distributed to our backers and local schools and libraries. The hope is to inspire youth to read for pleasure and to show them that they have valuable opinions worth reading.

A Little More About Us:

Tutoring Plus is a small nonprofit located in the heart of the Area 4 neighborhood in Cambridge that has been serving students for over 50 years. T+ has run on a small budget while still supporting over 150 Cambridge youth a year. Through one-to-one tutor-student/mentor-mentee relationships, healthy relationships are built and students begin to experience success in the classroom and beyond. Feel free to learn more by exploring our website www.tutoringplus.org and/or watching our 50th Anniversary video at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GclQrfITGkE.

During the year we’ve noticed our students rise to the occasion and exhibit a passion for learning, when presented with the opportunity to express themselves through choice and hands-on interest driven activities. Our hope is to nourish this energy by providing resources and a safe place for students to explore literacy during the summer.

Youth Choice, Youth Voice Book Club is the spark we hope will build a culture of positive reading with T+ students. We hope this spark will eventually catch in neighborhoods around the country and the world.

With YOUR help we can push Tutoring Plus forward, serving our youth in the summer to develop a love of reading and convey their authentic writing voices in a safe environment.

Expenses:

Your donation will cover the materials and staffing cost of running our summer literacy program. If we raise 3,700 we can:

                  1.  Purchase kindles and books for all of our youth.

                 2.  Pay our hardworking and lovely staff to run the program

                 3.  Provide a weekly meal for book discussion

                 4.  Publish and distribute our book of original student writing! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to financially contribute to the campaign, you still can play a vital role by sharing this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and all other social media platforms. It is only with all of us working together that we can make this change happen for our T+ youth.

story: I am a poor single dad who desperately wants to go to ApostaCon in Omaha, Nebraska. I am guaranteeing that I will have enough fun for ten people, and that your contributions will be well spent. My facebook is facebook.com/bdanaher17 if you want to learn more about me beforehand. If you have any question FB Message me, I am too poor to own a phone.

story:
Our Indiegogo campaign has ended but the journey has just begun. 


Thank you for helping us meet our goal!!  We are currently accepting donations for our 2015 meet-up as well as our charitable affiliates here:  Donate to PlantBuilt

We also have some really cool PlantBuilt merch, like Vegan Muscle Team tank tops and hoodies up for grabs here Get some PlantBuilt Apparel!  




Team PlantBuilt shows you how to make Vegan Protein Pancakes with Sunwarrior Classic Rice Protein (same protein you get for donating during the final countdown!).

Check it out!!  Here's  sneak peek at our special edition PlantBuilt merch.  This is your only chance to score one.  This is a limited run and ONLY for Indiegogo campaign supporters ;) 

Short Summary

PlantBuilt is a team of vegan athletes who raise awareness about the benefits of veganism while also raising money for animal sanctuaries and vegan outreach.  PlantBuilt was founded in the fall of 2012 by a group of physique and bodybuilding competitors with the shared goal of promoting a vegan diet in a sport where eating animal products is gospel and being vegan is mostly unheard of.  It's easy to see one vegan win a show and cry "Genetics!" 

But when you see a team of vegans all winning at once.....

PlantBuilt chose the Austin, Texas “Naturally Fit Super Show” as their debut. Although, the PlantBuilt team members only made up 10% of the competition, every single competitor placed, and the team ended up taking home 40% of the overall trophies.  Not too shabby competing in a sport where it is standard to eat hundreds of grams of animal protein a day.  

This year, we've expanded beyond just bodybuilding and have added a Crossfit and Powerlifting team as well.  We now stand nearly 40 vegan athletes strong and will be competing at the Naturally Fit Super Show in Austin, Texas on July 26th and we plan to dominate.  Again.

We use our vantage point as vegan athletes, to be spokespeople for a vegan diet, clearly dispelling the weak-scrawny-vegan myths and putting the "But where do you get your protein?" questions to rest.  Every single team member also comes from the standpoint of ethical veganism as and it's beneficial impact on the planet. 

As a unit, PlantBuilt is able to spread our message far and wide, while raising money for farm sanctuaries and vegan outreach programs.  We utilize various forms of media to make our point about the benefits of vegan living in a way that is inviting and educational.  Individually, we work with our communities to promote and teach a vegan lifestyle, while raising awareness (and money) for animal welfare.  

Meet the team!!


What We Need & What You Get


What will my donation go towards?

All though PlantBuilt is a team of competitors, most team members mostly compete locally to keep costs of competing down. Despite the way it may appear on social media, no one on the team is a professional athlete. No one gets paid to train or compete, in fact, it is quite expensive, even at the local level. We are just regular people with day jobs that make time to train as best we can, and are mostly trying to make ends meet. Competing as a group is something that we need to do to prove, without a doubt, that you do not need to eat animals to be strong and fit, but for many it will be impossible to acquire the funds to do so on their own.

The costs of competing actually add up very quickly, especially when traveling to compete, which many members will be doing.  Competing, even locally, has many hidden costs such as your federation membership, entry fee, polygraph testing, and tanning.  Add to that the cost of flying in to get to the show and staying in a hotel as well as all of the costs of preparing for a show, such as a coach,  posing classes, and even your suit, and you are looking at anywhere from $1,500 to nearly $4,000 per competitor.  

Your donation will go largely to help cover these competitor costs.  It is imperative that the whole team competes together to have the largest impact and we have hand chosen some of the best vegan athletes around, and in order to be able to do this, we need to generate the funds to ensure that everyone can actually get to the show.  

As as non profit, the co-founders have been operating in the red, with no funding.  PlantBuilt’s expenses include printing out flyers, booth fees, running our website, and bookkeeping, to name a few.  If we continue on like this, PlantBuilt will no longer be able to continue and we will no longer be able to compete together as a team and have such a large impact for veganism.


The Impact

Slowly, but surely, we are changing the stereotypes.  It is much more common to hear about athletes, even at a professional level, going vegan.  Veganism has grown leaps and bounds in the past decade, but we still have a long way to go to change the way the world treats animals.  We believe in a three-fold approach:

-Direct action to support animals at sanctuaries, rescues, and shelters.

-Outreach programs that teach people about the benefits of veganism and also expose the horrors of animals for profit businesses.  

-Living as a glowing example of healthy vegans.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what PlantBuilt is doing, feel free to follow us on Facebook , Twitter , Instagram  and check out our competitor blog and other news at PlantBuilt.com


FAQ


When and where is PlantBuilt meeting up this year?

We're glad you asked!  PlantBuilt is checking in on July 23rd to the venue's hotel.  We have team workouts on the 24th and 25th and only those who have qualified to join us based on the perks, will be invited.  We will be at the Austin Convention Center on July 26th at the Naturally Fit Games.  We will be there from 10am - 10pm.  Anyone can come to the show as it's open to the public and tickets can be purchased at NaturallyFitGames.com .  The after party will be on July 27th and that is also only open to those who qualify to join us based on the perk they chose.   We check out on July 28th.


Can you tell me more about the after party?

Sure!  We will be having an invite-only celebration where those who qualified to join will be able to meet, greet and hang out with us!  It will be catered and food will be provided from the following local establishments:  Burgers and more from BBQ Revolution ,  a build your own sundae bar from Sweet Ritual and deserts from Capital City Bakery .  We will also have music and activities.  


I want to sign up to be an honorary team member.  When will my flight and travel arrangements be made?  Will there be transportation provided?

That's awesome, we are so excited to host you and hang out together!  Once you have signed up to be an honorary team member, we will contact you within 24-72 hours so that we can work on your flight itinerary together and to start planning ahead.  We will also have a schedule of events for your stay with us from July 23-28th before you arrive.  Hotel arrangements will be made prior to check in.  You will receive valet shuttle service to and from the airport.  During our stay in Austin, we will be riding together as a team in passenger vans and transportation will be provided as well at no additional cost.  Basically, you will be invited and encouraged to hang out with us for the entire duration of our stay.  This includes but is not limited to: both team workout and photo shoots, preferred seating at the Naturally Fit Games, our after party, team trips for grocery shopping, and much more,  If you need to go anywhere within a 3 mile radius of the venue hotel, transportation can be provided from our venue hotel at no cost to you.  


If you have any other questions please ask one of our team members by using the contact information provided on this page.  We will be answering more FAQs as they come up.  Thanks so much for your interest in PlantBuilt!

story:
Short Summary

Greetings!  My name is Amanda Feterl and I am the elementary art teacher at Sibley East Public Schools in Arlington, Minnesota.  Our school district may be small, but technology has always played a big role in education of our students.  I am constantly seeking out new and exciting ways to engage my students in their quest to champion creativity!  

About a year ago, I was home on maternity leave and saw a news report on 3D printers for use at home and school.  Initially, this TV segment sparked my imagination as I began to dream up ways that I could incorporate a 3D printer in my classroom.  However, the outrageous price for the hardware, software, and ink cartridges made it an unrealistic and unrealized dream.  Until now...

Fast forward to present day!  Just a couple of weeks ago I stumbled on to Indiegogo's site while riffling through some Twitter messages.  I was surprised to read how crowd-funding helped to bring a 3D printer to a small community, just like Arlington!  

So, here I am!  Expressing the magnitude of what you, as a potential contributor, can help me achieve for the 650+ elementary students that I teach.  But your impact won't just be felt by the students!  Administrators, school board, parents and community members will surely know, see, and talk about the amazing technology opportunity their children have experienced in art class.  Just imagine a student's reaction to holding an actual 3 dimensional object (which they designed) and only existed on a computer screen just moments before.  Transformational!

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $3,000 for the purchase of the following:

-Cubify Cube Printer ($1,299)

-Cubify Sculpt Software ($129)

-Cubify Ink Cartridges ($1,572)

The Cubify Cube Printer is currently the most kid-friendly 3D printer on the market because of its simplicity and the fact that there is no heat involved with the actual printing process.  Sculpt Software can be downloaded on to a computer or mobile device (our school has a 1:1 ipad initiative).  Obviously, there is a lot of cost with regards to the ink cartridges, however, I would like the opportunity to order all 18 colors that are available.  

One really cool aspect of the 3D printer is that it can be used to help generate income.  For example, necklaces and bracelets can be designed, printed and sold for a profit.  My hope is that over time, the money generated will pay for the purchasing of additional cartridges.  

The Impact

No doubt, this will be an unforgettable adventure for my students as they dream, design, and create their way through 21st century learning!

Other Ways You Can Help

I want to thank you personally for taking the time to read my campaign!  I really appreciate it!  If you are unable to contribute at this time, please consider helping me spread the word my project.  Indiegogo has fantastic sharing tools available for you to do this.  All my best!  ~Amanda

About a year ago, I was home on maternity leave and saw a news report on 3D printers for use at home and school.  Initially, this TV segment sparked my imagination as I began to dream up ways that I could incorporate a 3D printer in my classroom.  However, the outrageous price for the hardware, software, and ink cartridges made it an unrealistic and unrealized dream.  Until now...
Fast forward to present day!  Just a couple of weeks ago I stumbled on to Indiegogo's site while riffling through some Twitter messages.  I was surprised to read how crowd-funding helped to bring a 3D printer to a small community, just like Arlington!  
So, here I am!  Expressing the magnitude of what you, as a potential contributor, can help me achieve for the 650+ elementary students that I teach.  But your impact won't just be felt by the students!  Administrators, school board, parents and community members will surely know, see, and talk about the amazing technology opportunity their children have experienced in art class.  Just imagine a student's reaction to holding an actual 3 dimensional object (which they designed) and only existed on a computer screen just moments before.  Transformational!
What We Need & What You Get
My goal is to raise $3,000 for the purchase of the following:
-Cubify Cube Printer ($1,299)
-Cubify Sculpt Software ($129)
-Cubify Ink Cartridges ($1,572)
The Cubify Cube Printer is currently the most kid-friendly 3D printer on the market because of its simplicity and the fact that there is no heat involved with the actual printing process.  Sculpt Software can be downloaded on to a computer or mobile device (our school has a 1:1 ipad initiative).  Obviously, there is a lot of cost with regards to the ink cartridges, however, I would like the opportunity to order all 18 colors that are available.  
One really cool aspect of the 3D printer is that it can be used to help generate income.  For example, necklaces and bracelets can be designed, printed and sold for a profit.  My hope is that over time, the money generated will pay for the purchasing of additional cartridges.  
The Impact
No doubt, this will be an unforgettable adventure for my students as they dream, design, and create their way through 21st century learning!
Other Ways You Can Help
I want to thank you personally for taking the time to read my campaign!  I really appreciate it!  If you are unable to contribute at this time, please consider helping me spread the word my project.  Indiegogo has fantastic sharing tools available for you to do this.  All my best!  ~Amanda

story:
Video

This is a video with all of the pictures from the opening day of the Senior Day Care Center.

Mission Costa Rica

Nakiah and Baylee will be flying to Costa Rica on October 7th. Their main project will be working in a senior daycare center in Fraijanes. In this part of Costa Rica there is a large number of Seniors who are left withoit care during the day while their families are at work. The Senior Day Care Center openen in June 2013 and gives seniors a safe place to spend the day. 

Your Contribution 

The money raised will be used for Nakiah and Baylee's living costs in costa Rica for 8 months, as well as transportation. They need around $2,500 for this, but have made their goal $3,000 to raise money for the Senior Day Care Center.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help Nakiah and Baylee on their trip, but are unable to contribute financially, you can send this site URL to your friends and family to spread the word! 

Thank You!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Liz and I have been involved in international sport for some time now, both at the representative, and recreational levels. I have an unstoppable passion for sport, and believe that it is one of the most powerful tools we have at our disposal. In February, I will be embarking on a 5 month journey through 10 African countries, and 22 schools and communities to work towards tackling 3 of the 8 UN development goals through rugby. These include: promoting gender equality and empowering women, combating HIV/AIDS and other communicable diseases, and developing a global partnership for development. The objective is not just to go in, give money, or a bit of time, and then leave them with a distant memory and not much else. The project is designed such that we give leaders and members of the community the tools and knowledge of how to continue what we've started after we've left, and to empower individuals to carry out those projects. 

In order to make this mission happen, it is going to take a considerable amount of funds...which is why I've started this campaign! By contributing to this project, you will personally change not one, but any number of people's lives, both children and adults. ALL FUNDS RAISED GO DIRECTLY TO THE PROJECT. There is no middle man, no commission to anyone for handling money, literally everything goes to funding the project. This is an Officially registered charity, and you can absolutely get tax receipts for it! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Goal: £8,700. The project is carried out in Ethiopia, Kenya, Uganda, Rwanda, Tanzania, Malawi, Zambia, Botswana, Namibia, and South Africa over 5 months. The funding for the project goes towards preparing educational material and bringing in educators to talk about HIV/AIDS and the prevention of communicable diseases; the second part of the funding goes towards the equipment and venue costs for hosting the rugby sessions with the children, coaches, and community leaders, as well as the food they are provided during those days. The last part of the funding goes towards the logistics of the trip, and transport between cities/countries and lodging over the course of 5 months.
  • This project has been running for 3 years now, and has had a profound impact to-date. We run alongside and support NGOs, national rugby unions, government departments, and schools to ensure we spread our roots as much as possible. 
  • As much as I endeavour to reach my entire goal, if I am not able to, all funds raised will go to the project and the remainder will come out of pocket. This is something I feel incredibly strongly about and the impact our work will have, as well as the lessons we will learn from them is not lost on me.  

The Impact

  • Health Education: Partnering with G4S, we teach local school children about prevention of communicable diseases, something that is a very real problem to them in their lives and invaluable information. 
  • Gender Equality and Empowerment: Both boys and girls are involved in the project, teaching respect, and gender equality. We also aim to empower both kids and teachers and communities members to lead and be confident in what they do. 
  • Development: The final, and perhaps one of the greatest impacts the project has is in development. With increased leadership, empowerment, and happiness, the community members gain motivation towards working together in the future. 
  • This project is in its third year, and has already built up a strong network of schools and community partners so far. As a result, those schools have had their headteachers take on coaching roles, and having some sort of rugby during the year, in preparation for next year's project. This just shows that the way the project is being delivered is accomplishing its goals by encouraging development. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't make a donation yourself, doesn't meant you can't help!! u Please, please, please pass this on to your friends, family, businesses you think could contribute. I really think this is doable. If you think about it, even if 6 of your friends, get $10 from all their friends on their social media, that would cover the costs and more!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

I really think this is doable. If you think about it, even if 6 of your friends, get $10 from all their friends on their social media, that would cover the costs and more!
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What is the Rancing Revolution?

It is the project of Rancing Revolution to inspire, facilitate and advance conversations on the topic of bullying, and to do so in a way that not only discourages bullying behavior but also simultaneously encourages its positive counterparts - freedom of expression, acceptance of diversity, social support and overall health and well-being. 

Our three-pronged approach - through Youth Education, Adult Education and Social Activism- frames the issue of bullying in the language of oppression and addresses both bullying behavior and lateral violence in a systems-perspective approach to this social problem.  Our solution-focused mission is to eliminate bullying behavior from all levels of our society by inspiring and sustaining active cultures of Kindness.

Using macro-level theory based in critical social construction and oppression theory, as well as normative campaign strategy, the multi-part educational curriculum addresses bullying behavior in relation to the following themes:

  •  Power, privilege and oppression
  •  Culture and norms 
  •  Difference and diversity
  •  Computer-mediated communication  
  •  Fear
  •  Shame and vulnerability  

Our programming strives to cultivate counter-cultures emphasizing the primary values of empathy, authenticity and social support. 

Why we need your support!

This year, with the support of an Americorps VISTA grant, Rancing Revolution is partnering with the University of Vermont and the Dewey House for Civic Engagement to implement a collaborative program that partners college student mentors with local schools and youth organizations to support the implementation and facilitation of Rancing Revolution programming.  But to really get this program off the ground, we need your help!! 

Your financial contribution would help support:

  • The finalization of curriculum development
  • The printing and distribution of educational materials
  • The training of facilitators
  • The costs of transportation and facilitation
  • The cultivation of future partnerships, collaborations and outreach

The potential and growth of this program depends largely on this support!  Join the Revolution and take an active role in inspiring, creating and sustaining positive social change!  

What folks are saying about Rancing Revolution programs so far:

We're gaining recognition for our work outside the classroom as well! Check out the "In the News" section of our website to see clips on Channel 3, Channel 5 and a video by the Burlington Free Press.

“It’s okay to be different and people need to understand that. And people need to be kinder to each other – I have been trying to just to say ‘hi’ to more people in the halls and talk to different people than I normally do” – Allie, u32 middle school student

“Every person needs to change their mindset, one at a time” –Emily, u32 middle school student

“Rancing puts you in an uncomfortable situation to make you realize every single day people are judged, evaluated, ridiculed and mocked for simply expressing themselves.It really made me look at how we as a culture view difference.” –Alec, UVM SW student

“The act of Rancing can be a reminder that we are not alone in our struggles and that every person has joy inside of them that they can share.” –Amy, UVM SW student

“Rancing definitely made me feel empathetic towards those who don’t necessarily fit into the ‘norms’ of society, whether it’s their actions, their looks, or their identity that makes them feel excluded.” – Jasmine, UVM SW student

“I’ve always thought bullying was for middle school kids but you made me think about it and realize it happens even with adults. I would like to join and participate to help bring about change and a shift in thinking! I feel like this workshop was the highlight of my nursing career.”  -- Stephanie, UVM Nursing student

Meet the Team!

"My name is Corey Richardson and I am a co-founder and Director of Rancing Revolution. I also teach social work part-time at the University of Vermont, coach youth soccer and am working on my Doctoral degree (dissertation on the topic of Bullying) through Tilburg University in the Netherlands. For me, Rancing Revolution is a labor of love. I have donated thousands of dollars and a year and a half of my life getting this project off the ground. I have done this because I am passionate about social change, about the true power and courage of Kindness, and about the possibility of paradigm-shifting social work revolutionizing the way we look at Bullying and other social problems. Martin Luther King, Jr. said, 'Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that.' I believe that, and it is that notion which guides this work."

“My name is Kailee Brickner-Mcdonald, director of the Dewey House for Civic Engagement at UVM. Rancing Revolution brings together two of my favorite things -- playing and making positive social change. Rancing started as simply a fun thing to do with friends when I was a student at the College of William and Mary. Now, to be able to work with the activity of Rancing as a metaphor and learning experience is amazing! I've worked with students who want to change the world since 2007-- in museum education, as a campus organizer for public interest campaigns, and most recently as Director of the Dewey House. Some of my most meaningful experiences include being one of the lead facilitators for UVM's Next Step Social Justice Retreat, developing the Dewey House curricula for service-learning courses, and seeing the constant growth and learning which students inspire in my own life.”

"My name is Marie Hebert and I am a recent UVM graduate in Community Development and Applied Economics. I've had the opportunity to work with many non-profit organizations both local and abroad, which ultimately led me to Rancing Revolution in my final year of university. With such a fun, positive way to go about bullying prevention, I was immediately hooked. I am very much looking forward to further spreading Rancing Revolution's message as an AmeriCorps VISTA this year."

“My name is Michael Hill, Jr., and I am a UVM graduate student in the Masters of Social Work program. I am very excited to be a part of the Rancing Revolution team. I have realized that I want to dedicate myself to making the greatest positive change I can in this lifetime. I’ve witnessed inspiration through working for AmeriCorps as a City Year member and doing community rehabilitation with middle school students through civic engagement. The Rancing Revolution message is dedication and inspiration in its purest form, dedication to changing the negative and instead embracing the positive; this message is the appropriate fuel for social change. As a new member to the Rancing Revolution family I am excited about devoting my skills, experience and perspective towards empowering a better community, hopefully one day a better world as well.”

“My name is Matt Tucker and I really enjoy helping people manage their small business or nonprofit. I train people to set up accounting systems, create business plans, and organize data. I am drawn to Rancing Revolution because of its simple and powerful message of being yourself and 'Rancing to your own beat'. I’m very excited to work with the Rancing Revolution team and to contribute to the development of an inspiring organizing and a meaningful anti-bullying curriculum that resonates with children and adults everywhere.”

"My name is JB Barna and I am a 52 year old social work educator at the University of Vermont who believes strongly in the power of kindness and positive energy. I have always been drawn to using our authentic selves to build relationships - relationships that end up being the foundation for social change and activism. Rancing Revolution gives me the opportunity to be engaged in the excitement generated by these concepts as they interact with bullying at all levels. And besides, it's really fun to think and create with the team of people Corey has brought together."

“My name is Rory Schulman and I am the owner of Red King Production, a company dedicated to taking video projects from concept to completion. I have been professionally shooting and editing videos for the past seven years, and believe that using video can be a great vehicle to help get the Rancing Revolution message out to the world. I think people sometimes forget that bullying can continue into adulthood, so getting the word out there is very important."

Risks and challenges

Cultures of bullying weren't built in a day, and actually have the potential to be strengthened on a daily basis! Dismantling bullying cultures and creating cultures of kindness takes change at both the individual and social level. This is hard work! The Rancing Revolution curriculum is an evolving document, constructed to acknowledge and reflect this challenge. We strive to build long-term relationships with schools and organizations, working together and evolving together to help create and sustain incremental change over time.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kristien Van Vlasselaer and I am a third year PhD candidate at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in Troy, NY.  I moved here from Woodside, CA to follow my educational dreams, explore the east coast and most importantly learn, learn, LEARN!
Academic sciences are experiencing major budget cuts across the board and my lab is no exception.  However, my situation is unique in that the Biology Department which agreed to fund me underestimated how successful (and therefore expensive) my project would be and I find myself without money until July 2014.  
I am asking for any contribution, great or small, which will allow me to continue to pursue my cell migration project and thus graduate from RPI next year so I can go out into the real world and start making a difference! 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is $2,500 which is a gross underestimate of what I really need to finish my degree.  If you're wondering how much multiply that by ten...and then double it.  This science stuff is both financially and intellectually draining!  Contributions to my project will go toward my last two years of doctoral research.  I am working on figuring out the mechanisms that make astrocytes, cells which help the neurons in your brain and spinal column, migrate and move.  This research is critical to creating therapeutics for spinal column damage and paralysis as well as for combating astrocytomas which are currently the most common type of brain cancer. My research can only continue if my cells are growing and I can purchase the things I need to both collect and then analyze my data!

If you contribute to my project I am willing to share unique parts of my graduate student life with you.  The following are some of the fabulous perks I am offering:

- A picture of me totally stoked to be in the lab when I receive your donation!

- An in depth, over the top explanation of my project in such detail that you will understand my project and also grow to hate the words "guanine nuclear exchange factor", "GTPase" and "astrocyte migratory potential" because I won't be able to stop talking your ear off!

- A copy of scientific articles or review articles I am able to write due to your donation!

- An invitation to my PhD defense (Coming live to an auditorium in Troy, NY SPRING 2014)!

- A radiantly joyful picture of myself at said PhD defense upon hearing that I passed and am now a DOCTOR!

- A huge, thankful hug next time I see you in person and a heartfelt thank you for helping me to accomplish my dream!  

- And many more that I haven't thought of yet...

As I said below, $2,500 isn't nearly what I need to finish this project and I hope to be able to raise much more.  However, any money that does get donated to this worthy, fabulous cause will go toward purchasing cell culture materials, antibodies for cell staining and analysis, chemicals for buffers, test tubes, carbon dioxide tanks and a whole assortment of things necessary to keep a cell biology lab going strong.  Believe me, no donation is too small!

The Impact

Like I mentioned before, my research into astrocytes has long term implications in spinal cord and brain trauma as well as in astrocytoma cancer research.  Astrocytes function in a variety of roles but the simplest way to describe them is as cells which support your neurons structurally and chemically and also react to trauma.  Although I'm using astrocytes as my cellular model, I'm truly interested in the GTPases, known as molecular switches, and their regulators, guanine nuclear exchange factors (GEFs), which are responsible for cell movement.  Although GTPases are well understood, the proteins that regulate them are not and neither GTPases nor GEFs are well characterized in astrocytes.  My research increases both short term basic biological understanding as well as long term possibilities for spinal damage and brain cancer therapies.  Just like letters make words which make sentences and paragraphs that change the world, academic research increases basic understanding which grows and grows to eventually lead to cures  that make people's lives longer and better.  

Once I finish my PhD I plan on pursuing post doctoral study aimed to make me an even better (and nerdier) scientist.  After the post doc I hope to work in the biotechnology industry working on creating new and innovative therapeutics which help people feel and live better.

I could go on about the impact of my work or academic research in general at length and would be happy to do so if you are at all interested but I'll stop here for now.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute I completely understand and thank you for reading about my project anyway.  However, if you could forward my plight across the interwebs (facebook, email, reddit, or tell whoever is sitting next to you on the bus) I'm much more likely to meet and hopefully exceed my goal.  The perks I offer are always up for negotiation and I'd love to explain what I do to anyone that's interested.  Please, please, please help me to finish this degree so I can go on to work in biotechnology and make people's lives better!

Thanks so much for taking the time to hear my story!

Short Summary
My name is Kristien Van Vlasselaer and I am a third year PhD candidate at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in Troy, NY.  I moved here from Woodside, CA to follow my educational dreams, explore the east coast and most importantly learn, learn, LEARN!
Academic sciences are experiencing major budget cuts across the board and my lab is no exception.  However, my situation is unique in that the Biology Department which agreed to fund me underestimated how successful (and therefore expensive) my project would be and I find myself without money until July 2014.  
I am asking for any contribution, great or small, which will allow me to continue to pursue my cell migration project and thus graduate from RPI next year so I can go out into the real world and start making a difference! 


What We Need & What You Get
My goal is $2,500 which is a gross underestimate of what I really need to finish my degree.  If you're wondering how much multiply that by ten...and then double it.  This science stuff is both financially and intellectually draining!  Contributions to my project will go toward my last two years of doctoral research.  I am working on figuring out the mechanisms that make astrocytes, cells which help the neurons in your brain and spinal column, migrate and move.  This research is critical to creating therapeutics for spinal column damage and paralysis as well as for combating astrocytomas which are currently the most common type of brain cancer. My research can only continue if my cells are growing and I can purchase the things I need to both collect and then analyze my data!
If you contribute to my project I am willing to share unique parts of my graduate student life with you.  The following are some of the fabulous perks I am offering:
- A picture of me totally stoked to be in the lab when I receive your donation!
- An in depth, over the top explanation of my project in such detail that you will understand my project and also grow to hate the words "guanine nuclear exchange factor", "GTPase" and "astrocyte migratory potential" because I won't be able to stop talking your ear off!
- A copy of scientific articles or review articles I am able to write due to your donation!
- An invitation to my PhD defense (Coming live to an auditorium in Troy, NY SPRING 2014)!
- A radiantly joyful picture of myself at said PhD defense upon hearing that I passed and am now a DOCTOR!
- A huge, thankful hug next time I see you in person and a heartfelt thank you for helping me to accomplish my dream!  
- And many more that I haven't thought of yet...
As I said below, $2,500 isn't nearly what I need to finish this project and I hope to be able to raise much more.  However, any money that does get donated to this worthy, fabulous cause will go toward purchasing cell culture materials, antibodies for cell staining and analysis, chemicals for buffers, test tubes, carbon dioxide tanks and a whole assortment of things necessary to keep a cell biology lab going strong.  Believe me, no donation is too small!


The Impact
Like I mentioned before, my research into astrocytes has long term implications in spinal cord and brain trauma as well as in astrocytoma cancer research.  Astrocytes function in a variety of roles but the simplest way to describe them is as cells which support your neurons structurally and chemically and also react to trauma.  Although I'm using astrocytes as my cellular model, I'm truly interested in the GTPases, known as molecular switches, and their regulators, guanine nuclear exchange factors (GEFs), which are responsible for cell movement.  Although GTPases are well understood, the proteins that regulate them are not and neither GTPases nor GEFs are well characterized in astrocytes.  My research increases both short term basic biological understanding as well as long term possibilities for spinal damage and brain cancer therapies.  Just like letters make words which make sentences and paragraphs that change the world, academic research increases basic understanding which grows and grows to eventually lead to cures  that make people's lives longer and better.  
Once I finish my PhD I plan on pursuing post doctoral study aimed to make me an even better (and nerdier) scientist.  After the post doc I hope to work in the biotechnology industry working on creating new and innovative therapeutics which help people feel and live better.
I could go on about the impact of my work or academic research in general at length and would be happy to do so if you are at all interested but I'll stop here for now.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute I completely understand and thank you for reading about my project anyway.  However, if you could forward my plight across the interwebs (facebook, email, reddit, or tell whoever is sitting next to you on the bus) I'm much more likely to meet and hopefully exceed my goal.  The perks I offer are always up for negotiation and I'd love to explain what I do to anyone that's interested.  Please, please, please help me to finish this degree so I can go on to work in biotechnology and make people's lives better!
Thanks so much for taking the time to hear my story!

story:
Short Summary

In May of 2013, after a two year battle with depression, I nearly lost.  Instead, I chose to remove myself from my life in a different way - by creating a new one.  I left everything: my job, my partner, even my belongings.  I packed myself, my dog, and my poetry books in my car and drove to my dad's house to plan what would come next in life for me.

I had lived in Taiwan briefly before, and leaving it had been difficult.  I knew I could go back and easily find work, and I knew I had been happy there.  After two years of sadness, I've decided to claim my own happiness.  No one is going to make me happy for me.  I'm doing this for myself - one of the first things I've done for myself in a long time.

What I Need & What You Get

The one way plane ticket alone ran me $922.  I was able to use some frequent flier miles to bring the price down by $200, but I still need to prepare my first month's rent as well as some preliminary cost-of-living type stuff until my first paycheck comes in - and I'm still out $800 from moving away from Arizona.  That's a long story, but the short version is gas is expensive and the help I had been counting on disappeared.

As you can see, Just the plane ticket and moving away from Arizona have already cost me far more than the low goal I've set for this fundraiser, and that's before figuring the money I need for startup in Taiwan.  But I've set this goal low hoping to meet it at least, while any overage will obviously be necessary and helpful.  By my estimates, $1541 will reimburse me for the plane ticket and the move out of AZ, and another grand will be sufficient startup in Taiwan.  $2541, then, would set me square and anything over that could allow me to go to Boston to have one last interaction with the national slam poetry community at the National Poetry Slam before I go.

What you get is - I mean good kharma obviously ;)  But you also get some original art made just by me!  I've been a performance poet for half my life now and this art has saved me many times over.  So I'd like to share my poetry with you and potentially even some horrible-but-hilarious visual art!  You get knowing that you helped someone create a better life for themself.  You get my undying gratitude, a cool postcard from the other side of the globe, and if you ever want to visit Taiwan, you can stay with me for free while you visit!

The Impact

This isn't some crazy whim.  I mean it kindof is, but also I've lived abroad before and I've lived in Taiwan before.  So I'm not going into this blind and unexperienced.  I'm committed, through contract, to living in Taiwan for at least two years and teaching English while I'm there.  The money I make while working there will mostly be going to pay off my student loans, as the cost of living is not high.  This is a responsible decision to be making, it just happens to entail moving to the opposite side of the globe.

This will also prepare me for a much brighter future.  With two years of experience as a teacher, and learning a third language, my future options will blow wide open!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you are not a rich person.  That's perfectly understandable - shucks, I'm the one trying to raise money on the internet, right?  But you can still help by spreading the word, and leaving messages of support.  Know that I appreciate just the knowledge that you believe in me!
