story:
Introduction

Hi, we are Team Zaya and come this July we will begin our 15,000 Kilometer journey driving from London to Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. We will be joining the Mongol Rally, a charity ride to raise awareness for education reform around the world. We are asking for just $1 for every kilometer that will be driving. This trip wouldn’t be possible without the sponsors like yourself, thank you so much!

We are going to setup 5 Orphanages along our route with our ZAYA Clouds. This will give children in these centers access to some of the best education content from around the world.  Imagine if a child in rural mongolia can learn from KhanAcademy and Ck12 like children in US schools do? 

Our Team:

Neil Dsouza - Founder and president of Zaya.org, “the tech guy,” champion for education reform

Sam Yang - Special events coordinator, philosophizer, adventurer

Leeza Livchitz - Assistant/intern, social activist, russian language expert

 

How We are Going the Extra “Kilometer”

We are going as a part of Zaya.org which is a non-profit specializing education technology. The Mongol Rally is not only a great way to raise awareness for education reform everywhere, but as a way to reach some of the most remote parts of the world to set up our education Zaya Clouds, a.k.a. our “hotspots.”

 

Our Technology

These “hotspots” or as we like to call them “Zaya Clouds” is a proprietary hardware and software solution that has a 10-hour power supply that is pre-loaded with all sorts of educational informations including; high impact videos, books, assignment resources, teacher-training curriculum, all on our adaptive learning platform. These “hotspots” create a wifi network anywhere in the world and can be accessed through laptops, desktop computers, tablets, and even mobile phones. This approach allows students to access educational content and for teacher to track their progress even if there is no internet access or electrical power.

 

The Support We Need

This epic journey  will take us 15,000 kilometers from London to Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. We are asking for just $1 per kilometer to help on items such as:  

  • - The “Hotspots” going into the schools and orphanages
  • - Buying the car (1500cc or less, which will donated one we reach Ulaanbaatar)
  • - Fuel for the car
  • - Visas
  • - Air travel
  • - Equipment to help us survive!
  • - Insurance!
  • - Food and lodging along the way
  • - Hopefully none going to bribes, fingers crossed

story:
Hello everyone my name is Rusty and I am a very proud father of an amazing autistic little boy name Gavin. When Gavin was only 2 years old his mother and I began to notice he was different. Long story short we took him to Akron Children's Hospital for an evaluation by a neurologist and he was immediately diagnosed with autism.

Both his mother and I feel very blessed to have such a special little boy. We agree that his autism has made him unique and defines him as an extraordinary human being. In spite of this it is still quiet difficult to communicate with him. Gavin can speak some words but for the most part he is non-verbal.

Monday through Friday Gavin goes to school with other young children like him with special needs. Over the summer when he was not in school he was going to a speech therapist once a week. Last time he was there his speech therapist showed me some of the activities he was doing with an Apple iPad. Gavin was doing things on the iPad I had never seen him do before.

Since then I have researched the benefits of using an iPad to help autistic children learn and communicate. I have found numerous web sites and videos showing how iPads are helping autistic children everywhere. Click on this link to learn more!

http://www.cnn.com/2012/05/14/tech/gaming-gadgets/ipad-autism/index.html

Gavin’s mother and I are asking for donations to buy Gavin and iPad. With an iPad he will have a voice and be able to show us what is on his mind. We will also be able to communicate with him on a level that he will be able to understand. It would be the perfect teaching tool!

Autism is a social disorder that affects 1 in 88 children, 1 in 54 are boys. For more info on Autism and Autism Awarness please go to http://www.autismspeaks.org/

Any donations over $500 will be given to a non-profit organzation called "ACT Today" that helps children with autism. For more info check out their site!

http://www.act-today.org/

Even if you can't donate you can still help by supporting Autism Awareness and learning how special these people really are :)

story:
Hi!

I'm Dave Allen, I am one of the Missionary candidates for Real Life Ministries in Post Falls Idaho!  I am asking you to help make a dream come true!

We have put together this campaign to rally up travel expenses for Jone Kata and his wife Fulori. They are joining us for a week of celebration, training, and team building.  Your great generosity will support them on this once in a lifetime trip, allowing them to join us, as we share what God has been doing internationally through relational discipleship!


What We Need & What You Get


We need to raise enough for flights and additional expenses (visa, transportation, etc.)  Any funds raised over expenses will be donated to the Kata family, to support their tireless work in Fiji! If we miss our goal :(.....  all funding will still go towards the cost of getting them here!  

Yep, you heard that right!  We are in the process of buying their ticket on the faith that we can raise up some money to offset the cost.  (In other words, I can't do this alone!) 

So...to do this...we are gonna be creative!  We are putting together a pile o' swag that will give you some bang for your buck!  Not only will you get the warm fuzzies for just being an awesome giver, but you'll also be getting cool artwork, O.F. (original Fijian) stuff, and More, More, More!


The Impact


To Jone and Fulori this is already a miracle!  Mere days ago they had believed that there was no way they could get to Real Life for this June event!  Fiji has a low approval rate for travel to the USA, but not for them, not this time!  Visas are approved, and officially they are free to get on over here!  

This is so very important to them.  Over the past several years they have been drawn into looking at Christ's methods for making disciples.  Christ's use of relationships, disciple making, walking together relationships, has reinvigorated their ministries.  The fruit of this has been so evident in their church and small groups  that others have been seeking them for advice.  They have been busy helping others turn their churches back into the loving, caring, earthly representations of Jesus they are called to be.  

So we are bringing them to Post Falls, Idaho for a couple of reasons.  

  • To share with their brothers and sisters in Idaho what their great faithfulness is doing in the South Pacific.
  • To team build, share meals, live together, get all Acts Churchy! 
  • To bolster their spirits and encourage them in prayer and in person.
  • To see what a temperature below 50 deg. F feels like!
  • To study and learn together what Christ modeled for us, in his relationships with his disciples, and how those relationships and methods are so timely and effective now.   Whew!


Risks & Challenges


Well......there aren't many!  We just put the tickets on our Visa, and we would sure like some help paying that cost off!  Really, it's only the risk that we might have to sell our our dog, and he's old and grumpy, wouldn't get us more than he could fetch, and that ain't much.  So we would just have to sell plasma or some such..... I think you get the picture!   Help us Help Them!  We Love em and you will too!


Other Ways You Can Help


So, not everyone has cash to spare, so how can you help otherwise?  Great question and glad you asked!  

  • Give them a warm welcome when you meet them!
  • Share this campaign with everyone you know!
  • Talk o Tina or I about a meal you would like to bring!
  • Be available to help transport them or others during Missions week!

story:
New York Cares Needs Your Help

Another 200 points on the SAT can mean the difference between going straight to work after high school or getting into the college of your dreams.

Weekly SAT tutoring sessions throughout the school year help high school students, who have a wealth of potential but a dearth of resources, gain acceptance to the college or university of their choice.

Donate today and create a future filled with unlimited possibilities for many New York City high-school juniors who dream of a college education.

About College Readiness Programs

In addition to SAT Prep, New York Cares also offers FAFSA and Sophomore Skills programming throughout the school year. Our FAFSA program is a crucial step for low-income teems and their families to complete applications for federal student aid. Sophomore Skills is designed to strengthen basic math, reading and writing skills at the tenth grade level. These opportunities provide low-income and under-served students with the additional support they need to prepare and pay for college.

Your Donation

New York Cares' unique ability to leverage the time and talents of tens of thousands of volunteers enables us to deliver six times the value of every dollar donated. All the funds raised through this campaign will go directly to our programs.  

One Round-Trip Airline Ticket!

Everyone who makes a donation of $100 or more will be automatically entered into a raffle to receive one round-trip ticket within the U.S. and Canada on Delta Air Lines*!

*Exclusions apply.

About New York Cares

New York Cares was founded by a group of friends, who wanted to take action against serious social issues that faced our city in the late 1980s. Finding few options to help, they created their own organization to address the problems from the ground up. New York Cares is now the city's largest volunteer management organization, running volunteer programs for 1,300 nonprofits, city agencies, and public schools.

More than 62,000 people volunteered with us this year because they know they make a real difference. Together, we helped 400,000 disadvantaged New Yorkers.

story:
I grew up very close to my Latin American heritage. Most of us know that the kitchen is the heart and hearth of a Latin family, and my family was no exception. It was not the food that drew us together, however. It was sobremesa.

 Sobremesa is a Spanish term that translates to around the table. It is the conversation you have while you nibble on appetizers. It’s the laughter you share when you have your post-meal coffee. It’s the stories we tell while experiencing a meal that we know no other family in the world was sharing. Because it was ours.

When I got older, when I moved into my own apartment, met my future wife, and started a career in marketing, I longed for sobremesa. I was social - I still am - but my friends did not venture much further than the neighborhood bar. Sure, drinking is fun, but it does not create memories. I became the chef of my friends, constantly inviting them over - or inviting myself over to their kitchen - to create whatever imaginative meal I could think of. Sometimes it fell flat, sometimes it was amazing. But it did not matter. My passion for cooking stems from drawing my loved ones close to me, sitting them at my table as we laugh and cry and share a creation of my own. We all grow old, some of us grow apart. But we can always hold on to the memories of being around the table, of sobremesa.

Now I have the chance to bring sobremesa back into my life by attending the Escoffier Culinary Institute in Boulder, Colorado. By attending this school, I will have the chance to share my love of sobremesa with more than just my family. Please help me reach my goal of attending this school and sharing sobremesa with the world.

This is a career change for me. There are many risks involved when you decide to pursue your passion and make it your career. Fear and the uncertain can easily stop you in your tracks, as well as money concerns. I am taking the first step by jumping in head first and hope to overcome all the uncertainties through love, support and, most of all, faith.

story:
Short Summary

My goal is to travel to Texas Tech University's Center in Seville, Spain and study Spanish there for the spring semester. While in Europe, over spring break and the three-day weekends, I hope to travel to countries like France and Italy so I can practice using both the French and Italian language skills I've developed on my own. As I hope to get my graduate degree in linguistics in the future, this semester abroad will help me to grow as a linguist and improve my language skills across the board. I have a deep passion for foreign languages and their respective cultures, so this trip would be extremely fulfilling on both an academic and personal level.

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost for the semester abroad is estimated by Texas Tech to be $15,863. This is a huge amount of money. While contributions are greatly appreciated, I don't expect to be able to fully pay for the trip with donations. There are several scholarships from Texas Tech and within the Spanish department I'll be applying for to help fund the trip as well.

The cost comes from a laundry list of fees required to be paid, as well as a few other in-country and pre-travel expenses. Those include: Seville Center program fee ($4075), education abroad fee ($75), tuition to Texas Tech ($4045), room and board ($3360), orientation ($280), excursions - to Lisbon, Portugal ($1043), student insurance ($180), passport ($135), Spanish visa ($100), textbooks ($100), airfare ($1200 roundtrip), in-country expenses ($1000 - est. $250/month), cell phone ($150) and a bus pass ($120).

    The Impact

    This semester in Spain will give me 15 credit hours toward my major in Spanish, a feat that can't be achieved in a single semester at Texas Tech (as five Spanish classes cannot be taken simultaneously in a semester). After finishing a semester abroad, I'll effectively be finished with my undergraduate degree (with the exception of a couple of credits to be taken in a summer semester) and be ready to move on to graduate school - a whole separate issue. 

    I'm proud to say that I'll be finishing my undergraduate degree so quickly, especially having only started my time in college a year ago. I had 18 hours of dual-credit that carried over to Tech from high school. I tested out of 6 hours of Spanish language upon my arrival to Tech as well as 12 hours of ASL (American Sign Language). In order to maximize my time in at a university in the most cost-effective manner, I've taken maximum hours each semester as well as summer classes. That being said, I hope this raises my credibility and proves my strong desire to study abroad. Without a semester in Spain, I won't be able to graduate as quickly as I hope.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      I understand times are hard and finances are tight, which is why I've come up with another way anyone can help contribute to my study abroad campaign.

      Share. It's just as simple as that. In our day and age, sharing information is just a click away. Please take a moment out of your day to help spread this page around to your friends and family. The action is GREATLY appreciated as well as any amount contributed.
story_txt:
Short Summary My goal is to travel to Texas Tech University's Center in Seville, Spain and study Spanish there for the spring semester. While in Europe, over spring break and the three-day weekends, I hope to travel to countries like France and Italy so I can practice using both the French and Italian language skills I've developed on my own. As I hope to get my graduate degree in linguistics in the future, this semester abroad will help me to grow as a linguist and improve my language skills across the board. I have a deep passion for foreign languages and their respective cultures, so this trip would be extremely fulfilling on both an academic and personal level.   What We Need & What You Get The total cost for the semester abroad is estimated by Texas Tech to be $15,863. This is a huge amount of money. While contributions are greatly appreciated, I don't expect to be able to fully pay for the trip with donations. There are several scholarships from Texas Tech and within the Spanish department I'll be applying for to help fund the trip as well.
The cost comes from a laundry list of fees required to be paid, as well as a few other in-country and pre-travel expenses. Those include: Seville Center program fee ($4075), education abroad fee ($75), tuition to Texas Tech ($4045), room and board ($3360), orientation ($280), excursions - to Lisbon, Portugal ($1043), student insurance ($180), passport ($135), Spanish visa ($100), textbooks ($100), airfare ($1200 roundtrip), in-country expenses ($1000 - est. $250/month), cell phone ($150) and a bus pass ($120).

  The Impact This semester in Spain will give me 15 credit hours toward my major in Spanish, a feat that can't be achieved in a single semester at Texas Tech (as five Spanish classes cannot be taken simultaneously in a semester). After finishing a semester abroad, I'll effectively be finished with my undergraduate degree (with the exception of a couple of credits to be taken in a summer semester) and be ready to move on to graduate school - a whole separate issue. 
I'm proud to say that I'll be finishing my undergraduate degree so quickly, especially having only started my time in college a year ago. I had 18 hours of dual-credit that carried over to Tech from high school. I tested out of 6 hours of Spanish language upon my arrival to Tech as well as 12 hours of ASL (American Sign Language). In order to maximize my time in at a university in the most cost-effective manner, I've taken maximum hours each semester as well as summer classes. That being said, I hope this raises my credibility and proves my strong desire to study abroad. Without a semester in Spain, I won't be able to graduate as quickly as I hope.
  Other Ways You Can Help I understand times are hard and finances are tight, which is why I've come up with another way anyone can help contribute to my study abroad campaign.
Share. It's just as simple as that. In our day and age, sharing information is just a click away. Please take a moment out of your day to help spread this page around to your friends and family. The action is GREATLY appreciated as well as any amount contributed.

story:
Who am I?

My name is Erica, and I am 25 year old female from a low income background. I am a graduate of the School of Visual arts in New York City with a BFA in Graphic Design. I am looking to make a career upgrade. I currently work at home as a freelance graphic designer and I want to make the leap into working in the tech industry. 

My life, like many of you, has since revolved around growing technology. It still does. Coding, like reading or writing, is becoming an essential skill. We will all interact with technology in our jobs, so learning to code will enable me to greatly increase my impact in tech world. 

I recently applied and was accepted into the Web Development Immersive at General Assembly - and I want to go!

What is the Scholarship fund?

Here is where your contributions will go:

  • Tuition is $11,500.00 and the program is full time for 3 months. I am raising the money to pay for my tuition, and expenses while attending full time.
  • As a designer, I am also offering a few of my skills in exchange for your contributions.
  • If I reach my goal, I will also donate 10% of my salary for 1 year, to an organization to help fund a scholarship for girls like myself, who in turn will do the same. I also will plan on volunteering my time teaching other girls to code.

Why is this Important?


There aren't a lot of women in tech and there should be!

  • Currently fewer women — a lot fewer women — are graduating from computer science programs and/or participating in the industry in a technically meaningful way than there were in the 1980s

  • As a designer who wants to work for digital and tech start-ups, people hire those who have programming and coding skills. I don't want to be left behind, and I need those skills!

  • Tech is a male dominated world, and I want to help change that. 

  • As a recent graduate, I am also crippled with student loans. My inconsistent work and low paying jobs haven't helped me financially. Attending this program will allow me to gain more career opportunities, get back on track with my student loans, and gain financial stability. 

The Challenge:

The full challenge is to raise the funds and to successfully attend and complete the program. It's an Intensive program, and that is no Joke. As a Graduate from Art School and knowing what it's like to have sleepless nights, I am fully prepared to dedicate every ounce of my time to being successful in the program and after it's completion. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please get the word out and pass along to your friends and family.

story:
Dear Friends,

First and foremost, thank you for taking the time to learn more about the ongoing restoration efforts for LIRR #39.  While the Railroad Museum of Long Island is excited about the progress we are making in terms of fundraising, we recognize that this is an effort both driven by your generosity, and intended for your enjoyment.  With that in mind, we are always looking for new ways to not only raise the funds necessary to complete the restoration, but also to ensure the ability of our contributors to enjoy the fruits of their generosity.

For all who are unfamiliar with the locomotive, here is a brief history.  #39 is one of 31 4-6-0 G5s class locomotives built by the Pennsylvania Railroad’s Juniata Shops for operation on the Long Island Railroad, which was operated by the PRR at the time.  The class was designed to meet the unique demands of suburban commuter operations, which required both significant tractive effort and acceleration capabilities.  #39 was built in 1929, and was among the last steam locomotives remaining in service on Long Island when the process of full dieselization was completed in 1955.  Along with #35, which also survives, #39 participated in the railroad’s “Operation:  Changeover” ceremony in October of 1955.

Upon her retirement, #39 was displayed at the Carriage House Museum in Stony Brook.  In 1980, the locomotive was removed from display and moved to Riverhead in preparation for an operational restoration.  After three decades of struggles involving funding and logistics, the decision was made to negotiate an agreement with the Strasburg Railroad, who was already handling the contract work on the boiler at the time.

The current agreement between RMLI and the Strasburg Railroad will see the locomotive placed into operation within three years of successful fundraising from RMLI.  The Strasburg Railroad will contribute more than $1 million to the project, with RMLI responsible for the other $1 million.  While Strasburg has this sum of money readily available, our museum does not…and that’s where we need your help!

A successful return to operation would be highly significant to the worlds of steam preservation, Long Island history, and Pennsylvania heritage.  The locomotive would hold such distinctions as the largest operational 4-6-0 locomotive in the world, the only operational Belpaire firebox in the US, and one of only two operational PRR-built locomotives at the present time.

Since the announcement of the agreement with the Strasburg Railroad in March of 2013, our fundraising efforts to date now total over $119,000.  Added on to the Strasburg Railroad’s portion of the funding, we are now well over halfway to finally making this decades-long dream a reality. It is our hope that you will continue to support the project, and allow us to give this beautiful piece of history the treatment that she deserves.

We strive for transparency in our fundraising efforts.  All documents relating to the project, including the lease agreement, scope of work, and restoration contract, can be found here http://www.rmli.us/RMLI/Documents.html  If you are still unsure of anything, please do not hesitate to contact any of us, we'll be happy to speak with you!

Steam on,

The Railroad Museum of Long Island


View more photos of G5s #39 by clicking "Gallery" on the top of the page.


PERK PHOTOS

$20 - The Final Days of Steam Postcard

Watermark will not appear on delivered postcard.


$39 - 'Tis the Season to be Steamin' Engine 39 glass Christmas Ornament.


$50 - Book Cover of "My Life on the LIRR"

$75 -  Authentic railroad spike, custom hand painted by Sara Kammeraad.


$100 - Enjoy a "behind the scenes" look at the Strasburg RR's famed locomotive shops on their popular shop tour


$200 - Receive a set of three different sized staybolt caps, the largest of which includes a flexible staybolt sleeve


$250 - The Strasburg Hostling Tour is a great way to learn how the Strasburg crew "wake up" a steam locomotive


$300 - The Railroad Museum of Pennsylvania Combo Pass is a great way to see historic steam locomotives on display, as well as discounted tickets for a ride on a steam hauled train at the Strasburg Railroad!


$500 - The Strasburg Railroad Dinner train is a great way to take that special someone on a ride to Paradise and enjoy a very unique meal


$1,000 - For the true Pennsy fan, a life size replica of #39's iconic keystone number plate makes for a spectacular display piece

story:
Short Summary




MusicWorks is a daily orchestral and ensemble music program fostering positive development of Lexington’s youth by providing equitable access to high-quality music education.  MusicWorks launched in August of 2013, and offers intensive study on string instruments and musicianship training for 21 second and third graders from Arlington Elementary School.  Students receive over 10 hours of instruction per week.  The program operates at no cost to participants.  MusicWorks is inspired by the musical and social philosophy of El Sistema, Venezuela’s national system of youth orchestras and choirs.

MusicWorks is a program of the Central Kentucky Youth Orchestras (CKYO). CKYO’s mission is to foster, in cooperation with public and private schools, quality musical opportunities for talented young musicians in the Central Kentucky region and provide affordable, family-friendly concerts to the community.


Learn more about MusicWorks through this article, slideshow, and video from the Lexington Herald-Leader: www.kentucky.com/2014/05/05/3228336/uncommonwealth-in-music-program.html

What We Need & What You Get

MusicWorks needs a mere $6000 to complete its funding goals for the first season of operation.  This remaining funding will help us provide daily instruction at no cost to participants, and provide students with a daily snack option.  Funding will also go towards sending all 21 MusicWorks kids to Cincinnati, Ohio on May 24th for a regional joint concert ("seminario") of El Sistema inspired programs in the midwest.

Here's a breakdown of what your donation could provide:

$5: Replaces a broken string

$15: Feeds the children a snack for a week

$50: Provides 5 shoulder rests for violins and violas

$110: Puts a new, tiny violin in the hands of a child

$250: Rehairs 5 bows

$500: Places a new, miniature cello in front of a student

$650: Sends the kids to Cincinnati for a full day of music-making with other El Sistema Kids

$750: Provides high-quality instruction for a week

$1000: Sponsors 1 child's participation in the program for half the year

The Impact

MusicWorks provides students with access to musical and educational opportunities they would not otherwise receive. Students must be present at school to participate in the program every day. This increases school attendance in MusicWorks students.  Countless studies show the positive impact music education has on scholastic achievement. MusicWorks staff regularly speak with students about higher education and achievement.


MusicWorks provides Lexington's youth with opportunities to excel and strive for excellence. The skills learned in daily musical activities can carry over into every aspect of life. Frequent performances provide tangible goals to students, empowering them to strive to achieve those goals. Performances in the the students’ respective neighborhoods build the sense of community between neighborhood residents and students and teachers. Frequent performances teach students to manage multiple goals simultaneously, and the importance of prioritization and cooperation in executing these goals. These skills are essential to developing a healthy, contributing citizen. Teachers place strong emphasis on building students’ self esteem and sense of pride in hard work.

MusicWorks strives daily to build better citizens through music, and we can't do it without your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Repost our campaign to your Facebook page and other social media sites!
  • 'Like' us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CKYOMusicWorks
  • Visit our website: http://musicworksckyo.org/
  • Volunteer! Contact Rachel at hockenra@gmail.com for more information!


All Central Kentucky Youth Orchestra programs are made possible in part through the generous support of LexArts (www.LexArts.org). The Kentucky Arts Council (www.artscouncil.ky.gov), the state arts agency, supports the Central Kentucky Youth Orchestras with state tax dollars from the National Endowment for the Arts.

story:
Following the BBC Panorama Program, Workers on the Breadline, I had to create this page.

Altough everyones story is heart breaking, Jason's story really touched me and I had to fight the tears as I know from my own experience how tough it can be.

So I am asking everyone and any business that wants to join this fundraiser to do or give whatever they can.

So please share the Twitter #givestockportjasonabreak to spread the word and we need to find this chap too.


All procidings to be donated to Jason and any businesses that want to help this campaign please get in touch at willyharlow@googlemail.com

Please spread the word and lets put a smile on this chaps face

story:
Saturday Oct 26 changed the life of 5 painters and their families. A powerfull explosion occurred at the workplace that resulted in one man dead another in critical care burn unit and 3 others to the burn unit.                                                                                                                                             

We feel these people and their families will need lots of help from the community. Please help get the word out at your workplace, every dollar will help us get to our goal and make this community proud.                                                                                      Our plan is to assemble 2 close friends or family members before the end of this campaign to determine how funds will be divided. e-mail or call anytime.

story:
What we do:

Muzewest is an organization that is dedicated to bringing together musical talent to leverage the power of art and music in improving the well-being of those in underprivileged communities.  

Our program involves two concert series’:

  1. Evening recitals
  2. Community outreach

Evening recitals feature world-class musicians from North America and Europe accompanied by art auctions with pieces provided by local artists.  Proceeds from these special evening events go towards funding our community outreach concerts in which the same world-class musicians go to schools, hospitals, and community centres to perform a second concert that is free of charge to the community.  


Impact

Through these free music concerts, over 2500 lives have been touched by the gift of live classical music through our educational programs in schools and our presence in rehabilitation, crisis, and community centres.


How you can help:

The past two years have been a great success, so this year we would like to even further our outreach efforts by providing 5 additional free concerts to communities in need.  

Your donation goes towards:

  • Contracting artists and musicians
  • Venue rentals, especially for communities without a suitable venue
  • Providing memorable media such as videos, CDs, and photos 

You now have the opportunity to contribute to our community outreach projects and bring the joy of music into the lives of those that wouldn’t otherwise have the chance to experience it. 

We also have more perks this year!  Check out the different opportunities to the right of the page and see how you can give back to the community!

For those who cannot donate, please help spread the word by sharing this campaign - share positive energy and help those in need!

story:
The Academy of Historical Arts has offered to provide a home for the collection in its full time training venue, The Vanguard Centre, but Triquetra will need to make some improvements to the environment in the facility to make it suitable for storing antiques. This is where we need your help!

What We Need

Help us develop sustainable atmospheric controls for the storage and protection of the Triquetra Collection. With your help we can manage the storage environment for the collection, which will allow us not only to preserve it further, but also to display it more actively and make it more accessible.

Our goal with this project is to install industrial dehumidifiers, temperature regulators, and a secure storage locker for the collection so it can continue to grow and so that we can begin to be bring it out for handling sessions more regularly.

The cost of the equipment for basic atmospheric controls and initial storage expenses is £1000. If we are able to raise this sum, we can make The Vanguard Centre into a suitable long-term home for the collection.

Stretch Goals

If we are able to raise £1500, we will be able to purchase a custom storage solution to secure the collection while not on display.

If we can raise £2500, we will be able to install a full time custom display case in The Vanguard Centre, where different items from the collection can go on display, allowing more people the opportunity to view and learn about the items in the collection.

If we can raise £6000, we will be able to install a mezzanine in The Vanguard Centre and build a set of custom display cases so that the whole collection is on full time display. This is our end goal for the collection and we hope that eventually The Vanguard Centre will have a small museum dedicated to the Triquetra Collection, making the various pieces accessible to the public and wider community.

Beyond this, we will put the money towards further expanding the collection and making more pieces available for study and furthering understanding of the Historical European Martial Arts. All arms acquired will be identified and photographed for inclusion in the collection’s website, and all books will have facsimiles created and made available to the community through Fallen Rook Publishing.

Perks

As a charity with (very!) limited sources of funding, we do not have the ability to offer a great deal of perks, but we would like to thank those who contribute to the campaign. Therefore, with the help of our corporate sponsors (the Academy of Historical Arts and Fallen Rook Publishing), we have managed to secure the following perks for those who help with this project:

  • £10 (your name will go into the Triquetra Collection Supporters page on the website as thanks)
  • £15 (thanks and a postcard of the collection)
  • £25 (thanks and an AHA patch, with free postage)
  • £50 (thanks, a patch and a free copy of the upcoming Fallen Rook Publishing facsimile of the original 1840 martial arts book by Donald Walker that is held in the Triquetra Collection, with free postage)
  • £75 (thanks and two hours of private HEMA or archery tuition at The Vanguard Centre)
  • £100 (thanks and free attendance in a month’s worth of drop-in sessions at The Vanguard Centre)
  • £250 (thanks and private handling session for you and up to 4 friends at The Vanguard Centre)
  • £750 (thanks and a weekend seminar for your club with Keith Farrell, with only travelling expenses and accommodation to be paid or otherwise arranged)
  • £1000 (thanks and a printed and hand bound reproduction of McBane’s book “The Expert Sword-Man’s Companion”, along with a copy of the entire Fallen Rook Publishing catalogue to date, and a first edition copy of each of the next 5 books  that come into print through Fallen Rook Publishing, with free postage)
  • £2500 (for such a generous contribution you will receive our thanks, a patch, a copy of the entire Fallen Rook Publishing catalogue to date, a first edition copy of the next 5 books that come into print through Fallen Rook Publishing, with free postage, and finally your name will be engraved on a brass plaque mounted on the front of the collections display cabinet.)

Risks and Challenges for the Project

The largest risk for this project is us failing to achieve our initial goal but any help we receive will lay the groundwork if we need to proceed with further fundraising. The project will be brought to a successful completion one way or another, but assistance from this fundraising campaign will bring us to success more swiftly.

About the Team

Trustees Ben Kerr and Keith Farrell are leading this project. They have previous experience with Indiegogo crowdfunding campaigns, having led the highly successful campaign to “Purchase the 1798 Copy of Roworth’s ‘The Art of Defence on Foot’” in the summer of 2014. That campaign raised £2125 (386% of its £550 original goal) from 89 backers. Within five months all perks had been delivered and the project brought to completion.

The Triquetra Services (Scotland) charitable organisation has the benefit of having both a Senior Librarian and the Curator of Arms and Armour at the Glasgow Museums on the board of trustees to ensure that the collection is well looked after and properly maintained. Further individuals offer knowledge, advice and professional skills to the board of trustees.

Our first corporate sponsor, the Academy of Historical Arts, exists to promote the study of history through the medium of the historical, martial and creative arts. We are an umbrella organisation to coordinate and aid the research and practices undertaken by our component groups and societies. Our belief is that if many like-minded groups work together towards a common goal then the end result is so much greater than if every group tries to work alone.

Our second corporate sponsor, Fallen Rook Publishing, is a company based in Scotland that has a strong interest in helping the international HEMA community grow and develop, supporting practitioners, instructors and events with scholarly books, facsimiles and reproductions of both historical fencing treatises and contextual history books.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially then please spread the word. If the international HEMA community comes together to help then we will be able to provide a safe and secure long-term home for our charity’s growing collection of antiques and to make it even more accessible to the community in the future. Tell your friends, clubmates, grannies if you must.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this campaign. Now please contribute if you can and help us protect this fantastic collection now an

story:
La explicacíon en español viene después de la de inglés

WHO AM I?

Hello! Hola! Bonjour! NiHao!

I’m Mauricio Monzon, I am 23 years old and I was born and raised in Asuncion, Paraguay. I moved to Taiwan 5 years ago thanks to a full scholarship.

While doing my major here in Taiwan, I had the privilege to represent my university in Germany, at the World Business Dialogue. I also did a summer internship in France, where I improved my level of french, and recently I participated in one of the biggest business competitions in the world, the Hult Prize.

My dream is to become a social entrepreneur, after my studies, I will help traditional artisans grow their market abroad! My country has so much to offer, we just need the right opportunity.


 

A NEW OPPORTUNITY KNOCKING ON MY DOOR

One morning, on my way to class, I checked my email to see if there was any news from any of the masters programs I have applied (since I applied for six masters). To my surprise, I found an email from the best business school in Norway (my first option), BI NORWEGIAN BUSINESS SCHOOL!, not only did I get accepted to the top 8th marketing master's program in Europe, but also I got a scholarship, covering tuition fees and part of living expenses!!! I cannot describe how happy and excited I was!
 

... but ...


WHY I NEED YOUR SUPPORT

The scholarship covers tuition fees and a part of my living expenses, but according to the Norwegian Immigration website, you need to prove that you have 110,000 NOK per year, and the scholarship gives me 90,000 NOK, which means that I need to get extra 20,000 NOK per year to get the student visa approved and renew it for the second year.

 

Expenses                             Cost in NOK                          USD equivalent

Flight Ticket                        NOK 12,775                            USD$ 1,500

First Year -

Living expenses                  NOK 20,000                           USD$ 2,400

Second Year -

Living expenses                  NOK 20,000                           USD$ 2,400

TOTAL                                    NOK 52,775                           USD$ 6,300

This represents a total of  $6,300-, which is an amount of money that my family is not able to cover, that is why I need your help gathering the money I  still need in order to be able to Study in Norway. Any amount you contribute, no matter small or big, will mean so much to me.

WHAT CAN I OFFER YOU?

As much as I would like to send you things from my country, I’m not there right now. So I promise I will send you a postcard from this beautiful island, Taiwan, with your name in Chinese ;) .

I’ll also upload photos and I will assist students looking for opportunities abroad, just text me and I’ll give you a hand since one of my goals is promoting international education and cultural exchange.

For all generous sums, I’ll send you beautiful Chinese paintings for you to decorate your house. So please follow me on social networks, and if you have a question, just ask me! I’ll be more than happy to chat (you can ask in Spanish, English, Chinese or French).

So through IndieGoGo, I ask for your help... to make my dream come true! And remember to share it with your friends, even if you cannot help directly yourself, maybe some of them can.

 

 

 

 

¿QUIÉN SOY?

¡Hello! ¡Hola! ¡Bonjour! NiHao!

Soy Mauricio Monzón, tengo 23 años y nací en Asunción, Paraguay. Me mudé a Taiwán hace 5 años gracias a una beca completa.

Durante mi carrera aquí en Taiwán, tuve el privilegio de representar a mi universidad en Alemania, en el World Business Dialogue. También hice una pasantía de verano en Francia, donde mejoré mi nivel de francés, y recientemente participé en una de las mayores competencias empresariales del mundo, el Premio Hult.

Mi sueño es convertirme en un empresario social, después de mis estudios, voy a ayudar a los artesanos tradicionales de mi país a expandir el mercado en el extranjero! Mi país tiene mucho que ofrecer, solo necesitamos la oportunidad adecuada.

UNA NUEVA OPORTUNIDAD SE ME HA PRESENTADO

Una mañana, de camino a la universidad, revisé mi correo electrónico para ver si había noticias de algunos de los programas de maestría que había aplicado. Para mi sorpresa, encontré un correo electrónico de la mejor escuela de negocios de Noruega (mi primera opción), BI NORWEGIAN BUSINESS SCHOOL !, no sólo fui aceptado en el 8º mejor programa de maestría de marketing en Europa, sino que también recibí una beca que cubre la matrícula y parte del costo de vida!!! No puedo describir lo feliz y emocionado que estaba!

... pero ...

POR QUÉ NECESITO SU APOYO

A pesar de haber obtenido la beca, de acuerdo con el sitio web del departamento de inmigración de Noruega, debo demostrar solvencia: 110.000 NOK por año, y la beca me da 90.000 NOK, lo que significa que necesito 20.000 NOK por año para obtener la visa de estudiante y luego renovarla para el segundo año de carrera universitaria.

Esto representa un total de $ 6,300-, una cantidad de dinero que mi familia no puede cubrir, es por eso que necesito tu ayuda para recaudar el dinero que aún necesito para poder estudiar en Noruega. Cualquier suma de dinero, no importa cuan pequeña o grande, significaría tanto para mí. Acordate de  compartir este video con tus amigos, incluso si no podes ayudar directamente, tal vez algunos de ellos sí puedan.

 

Gastos                             Costo in NOK                          Equivalente en USD

Billetes de Avión           NOK 12,775                            USD$ 1,500

Primer año

(costo de vida)              NOK 20,000                           USD$ 2,400

Segundo año

(costo de vida)              NOK 20,000                          USD$ 2,400

TOTAL                               NOK 52,775                           USD$ 6,300

 

¿QUE TE PUEDO OFRECER?

Por mucho que me gustaría enviarte algo de mi país, no estoy allí ahora mismo. Así que prometo enviar una postal de esta hermosa isla, Taiwán, con tu nombre en chino.

También voy a subir fotos y voy a ayudar a los estudiantes en busca de oportunidades en el extranjero, sólo envíame un mensaje y te voy a dar una mano, ya que uno de mis objetivos es la promoción de la educación internacional y el intercambio cultural.

Por todas las sumas generosas, enviaré hermosas pinturas chinas para decorar tu casa. Así que por favor, síganme en las redes sociales, y si tenés una pregunta, no dudes en contactarme! Estaré más que feliz de charlar (puedes preguntar en español, inglés, chino o francés).Así que a través de IndieGoGo, te pido su ayuda ... para hacer realidad mi sueño! Y recordá compartirlo con tus amigos, incluso si no podés ayudar directamente, tal vez algunos de ellos sí puedan.

story:
↓ ENGLISH   FRANÇAIS   ČESKY   ITALIANO  ↓

“Migrating Art Historians” on the go

The project "Migrating Art Historians" is a pedagogical and scientific experiment, taking the form of a 4-month pilgrimage. It takes a 1500-km route through Switzerland and France, from Lausanne to Mont Saint-Michel. The project aims to take a new look at the medieval heritage of France and Switzerland, from a point of view that a university education doesn’t usually provide. Eleven university students walk along medieval pilgrim routes, with 3-week stops at various important centers of monastic culture: Sainte-Foy de Conques, Saint-Benoît-sur-Loire and Mont-Saint-Michel in Normandy.

Our aim is to open the topic of art and medieval pilgrimage to a wider public. Also, we want to bring a new element to university education – the university not only as a place to receive theoretical information, but as a directly experienced practice.

Our project was made possible thanks to the support of many people and institutions. At the moment, the Migrating Art Historians have already walked 1,012 km and have completed a three-week stay in the Conques Abbey in southern France, where a one-week course featuring prominent world medievalists (Hans Belting, Sible de Blaauw, Cynthia Hahn) took place. Their lectures are available online for free.

 

 

In addition to the interest of scholars and the media, the project has been accompanied by the exceptional generosity of the people the students have met along their journey. They have become acquainted with France, where it is common to accept twelve pilgrims, feed them and offer them beds in the privacy of a home. The media shows us a France affected by an aggressive election campaign of the last weeks. But the Migrating Art Historians have primarily come across unbelievable manifestations of solidarity. 

 

 

 

The goal of this project is to share these scientific and human experiences.

Therefore, starting from April 27 you can watch a new short documentary movie produced by us every week (here). These movies will introduce the phenomenon of pilgrimage in its different aspects. They will focus, for example, on the important role of light and time in the life of a pilgrim and in a sacred space, or romantic ideas of the Middle Ages, but will also present the daily routine of pilgrims, their food or the unexpected twists they encounter on their way.

 

Watch our first movie devoted to pilgrimages across religions:

 

However, we need additional funding to create all the planned films.

 

The dramaturgy, screenplays, and camerawork are the work of the students / pilgrims themselves. However, for the best films to be made, the complete team includes professional editors and Czech and French actors who narrate the films with their voices. 

The calculated costs of this work is $6800. At the moment, we are able to cover the expenses for the first three movies. The amount requested is therefore $5100.

 

 

One of our most important goals is the production of a unique book in English and French. Students would be involved with the world's leading experts for its content. Graphic design will be done by talented designers working at the Center for Early Medieval Studies, who have already produced several award-winning publications.

The expenses necessary for the completion of this high-quality book are $2400 for graphic design, $3800 for the proofreading of students’ texts, $2000 for image copyrights, $3200 for editors and $9700 for printing. These costs will be partly covered by the Masaryk University, which provided us with an amount of $2400, designated for printing of the book. The Center for Early Medieval Studies will cover the proofreading and graphic design. The amount for the book desired to achieve is therefore $12500. 

 

 

If you want to learn more about the participants, see our web site.

 

***

« Historiens de l’art migrateurs » prêts à partir

 

Le projet « Historiens de l’art migrateurs » est une expérience pédagogique et scientifique, sous forme d’un pèlerinage de 4 mois. Il compte 1’500 km à travers la Suisse et la France, de Lausanne au Mont-Saint-Michel. Ce projet a pour but d’élaborer un nouveau regard sur l’héritage  médiéval de France et de Suisse, d’un point de vue inhabituel pour l’éducation universitaire. Onze étudiants universitaires vont emprunter les chemins de pèlerins médiévaux, avec trois arrêts dans des centres importants de culture monastique : Sainte-Foy de Conques, Saint-Benoît-sur-Loire et le Mont-Saint-Michel en Normandie.

 

 

Notre but est d’ouvrir le champ de l’art et du pèlerinage médiéval à un public plus large. Nous voulons également introduire une nouvelle approche au sein de l’éducation universitaire – l’université non seulement comme un lieu où on reçoit l’information théorique, mais également où on pratique des expériences pratiques.

Notre projet a pu être réalisé grâce à l’aide de nombreuses personnes et institutions. Actuellement, les historiens de l’art migrateurs ont parcouru 1012 km et ont achevé un séjour de trois semaines à l’abbaye de Conques au sud de la France, où a eu lieu un cours d’une semaine avec la participation d’importants médiévistes mondiaux (Hans Belting, Sible de Blaauw, Cynthia Hahn). Leur cours sont disponibles gratuitement en ligne.

 

 

En plus de l’intérêt des chercheurs et des média, le projet est soutenu par la générosité hors normes des gens que les étudiants rencontrent tout au long de leur chemin. Ils sont rentrés en contact avec une France où il est commun d’accepter douze pèlerins, de les nourrir et de leur offrir un lit dans le carde privé d’un foyer. Les media nous montre une France affectée par des campagnes électorales agressives des dernières semaines. Mais les historiens de l’art migrateurs sont principalement rentrés en contact avec des manifestations de solidarité incroyables. 

Les media nous montre une France affectée par des campagnes électorales agressives des dernières semaines. Mais les historiens de l’art migrateurs sont principalement rentrés en contact avec des manifestations de solidarité incroyables.

 

 

 

Le but de ce projet est de partager ces expériences humaines et scientifiques.

 

De ce fait, à partir du 27 avril, tu peux regarder (ici), chaque semaine, un nouveau court documentaire de notre production. Ces films vont présenter le phénomène du pèlerinage et les pèlerinages sous différents aspects. Ils vont se focaliser, par exemple, sur le rôle important de la lumière ou du temps dans la vie du pèlerin et dans l’espace sacré, sur les idées romantiques du Moyen Âge, mais vont également présenter la routine quotidienne des pèlerins, leur façon de se nourrir ou des imprévus sur leur chemin.

 

Regarde notre premier film dédié au pèlerinage à travers les religions:

 

Toutefois, nous avons besoin de financements supplémentaires pour créer tous les films.

 

La dramaturgie, les scénarios, et le tournage sont le travail des étudiants/pèlerins eux-mêmes. Cependant, pour que les films soient de qualité, l’équipe comprend aussi des éditeurs professionnels ainsi que des acteurs tchèques et français qui prêtent leurs voix aux films. 

Les coûts de leur travail s’élèvent à 6’800$. À présent nous sommes capables de couvrir les frais des trois premiers films, mais la somme requise est de 5’100$.

 

 

Un de nos buts primordiaux est la réalisation d’un livre unique en anglais et français. Son contenu sera produit par les étudiants et par les principaux experts mondiaux. La conception graphique sera réalisée par les concepteurs talentueux travaillant dans le Centre d’études médiévales, qui sont à l’origine de publication récompensées par des prix.

La somme finale pour achever un livre de haute qualité est de 2’400$ pour la conception graphique, de 3’800$ pour la relecture des textes d’étudiants, de 2’000$ pour les droits d’auteur des reproductions, de 3’200$ pour les éditeurs et de 9’700$ pour l’impression. Les coûts seront en partie couverts par l’Université Masaryk, qui nous a donné la somme de 2’400$ pour l’impression du livre. Le Centre d’études médiévales va couvrir les coûts de la relecture et de la conception graphique. Ainsi, la somme totale requise est de 12’500$. 

 

 

Si tu veux apprendre plus des participants va voir notre site web.

 

***

 

“Stěhovaví historici umění” na cestě

Projekt „Stěhovaví historici umění“ je pedagogickým a vědeckým experimentem, který má podobu čtyřměsíční poutě. Ta zahrnuje celkem 1500 km pěší poutě napříč Švýcarskem a Francií, z Lausanne do Mont Saint-Michel. Tento projekt si klade za cíl zkoumat středověké dědictví Francie a Švýcarska z úhlu pohledu, který běžné vysokoškolské studium neposkytuje. Jedenáct studentů při své výpravě následuje středověké poutnické cesty, přičemž se postupně zastaví ve třech významných centrech klášterní kultury: Sainte-Foy v Conques, Saint-Benoît-sur-Loire a Mont-Saint-Michel v Normandii.

Naším cílem je otevřít širokému publiku téma umění a středověkého poutnictví. Chceme ale také přinést nový prvek do univerzitního vzdělávání – univerzita ne pouze jako místo přijímaní teoretických informací, ale jako přímo prožitá zkušenost.

 

Náš projekt mohl být zrealizován díky podpoře mnoha lidí a institucí. V tuto chvíli mají „Stěhovaví historici umění“ za sebou 1012 km pěší chůze a třítýdenní pobyt v opatství v Conques na jihu Francie, kde proběhl týdenní workshop za účasti předních světových medievistů (Hans Belting, Sible de Blaauw, Cynthia Hahn). Jejich přednášky jsou zdarma dostupné na internetu.

 

 

Kromě zájmu badatelů a médií je celý projekt provázen výjimečnou štědrostí lidí, které studenti na své cestě potkávají. Přichází tak do kontaktu s prostředím Francie, kde je běžné přijmout dvanáct poutníků, nasytit je a poskytnout jim přístřeší. Média nám ukazují Francii zachvácenou agresivní předvolební kampaní posledních týdnů. Stěhovaví historici umění se však setkávají především s neuvěřitelnou vlnou solidarity.

 

 

 

Cílem celého projektu je sdílet tyto vědecké i lidské zážitky.

Proto od 27. dubna můžete každý týden sledovat nový krátkometrážní dokumentární film z naší produkce (zde). Tyto filmy představí fenomén poutě a poutnictví v nejrůznějších podobách. Zaměří se např. na důležitou roli světla nebo času v životě poutníka a v posvátném prostoru, romantické představy o středověku, ale ukážou Vám i denní rutinu poutníků, jejich stravování či nečekané zvraty na jejich cestě.

 

Podívejte se na náš první film věnovaný poutím napříč náboženstvími: 

 

 

Na tvorbu všech plánovaných filmů však potřebujeme další finanční prostředky. 

 

Dramaturgie, scénáře a kamera jsou prací samotných studentů/poutníků. Aby však výsledné filmy byly co nejkvalitnější, součástí celého týmu jsou i profesionální střihači a čeští a francouzští herci, kteří svými hlasy filmy doprovázejí. 

Vyčíslené náklady na jejich práci jsou 6800 $. V tuto chvíli jsme schopní pokrýt náklady na první tři filmy. Částka, kterou si přejeme získat je tedy 5100 $.

 

 

Jedním z našich nejdůležitějších cílů je vznik jedinečné knihy v angličtině a francouzštině. Na jejím obsahu se budou podílet studenti spolu s předními světovými odborníky. Grafického zpracování se ujmou talentovaní designeři působící v Centru raně středověkých studií, pod jejichž rukama vzniklo již několik oceňovaných publikací.

Celkové náklady na realizaci takto kvalitní knihy jsou: 2400 $ na grafické zpracování, 1900 $ na jazykové korektury textů studentů, 2000 $ na autorská práva k reprodukcím, 3200 $ na redakci a 9700 $ na tisk.Tyto náklady částečně pokryjeme díky podpoře Masarykovy univerzity, která poskytne částku 2400 $ na tisk knihy. Centrum raně středověkých studií pak zaplatí náklady spojené s korekturami anglických a francouzských textů studentů a s prací grafiků. Částka, kterou bude nutné získat je tedy 12 500 $. 

 

 

Chcete-li se dozvědět více o všech účastnících pochodu, navštivte naše webové stránky.

***

 

“Migrating Art Historians” in cammino

 

Il progetto "Migrating Art Historians" è un esperimento pedagogico e scientifico, che assume la forma di un pellegrinaggio della durata di 4 mesi. Si svolge lungo 1500 chilometri attraverso la Svizzera e la Francia, da Losanna a Mont Saint-Michel. Il progetto aspira a rivolgere uno sguardo di tipo nuovo sull’eredità artistica medievale di Francia e Svizzera. Un punto di vista che, di norma, la formazione universitaria non offre. Undici studenti universitari camminano lungo le rotte medievali di pellegrinaggio, effettuando soste di 3 settimane in alcuni significativi centri di cultura monastica: Sainte-Foy a Conques, Saint-Benoît-sur-Loire e Mont Saint-Michel in Normandia.

 

Il nostro obiettivo è quello di comunicare a un più vasto pubblico argomenti inerenti all’arte e al pellegrinaggio medievale. Vogliamo inoltre apportare nuovi elementi alla formazione universitaria, intesa non solamente come luogo di apprendimento teorico ma anche quale fulcro di un’esperienza didattica da vivere in prima persona.

Il nostro progetto ha potuto vedere la luce grazie al sostegno di tante persone e istituzioni. Al momento, gli Storici dell’Arte Migranti hanno già coperto 1012 chilometri di cammino e hanno terminato un soggiorno di tre settimane nell’abbazia di Conques, in Francia meridionale, dove sarà tenuto un corso di una settimana che vedrà la partecipazione di medievisti di fama mondiale (Hans Belting, Sible de Blaauw, Cynthia Hahn). Le loro lezioni saranno disponibili online gratuitamente.

 

 

Oltre all’interesse dimostrato dagli studiosi e dai media, il progetto nel suo insieme è accompagnato dalla eccezionale generosità che gli studenti incontrano durante il loro viaggio. Essi hanno avuto il loro incontro con la Francia, un paese dove è normale accogliere dodici pellegrini, dare loro da mangiare e offrire loro un posto per dormire nella privacy di una casa. I media, nelle ultime settimane, ci hanno mostrano una Francia caratterizzata da una campagna elettorale aggressiva. Ma gli Storici dell’Arte Migranti hanno incontrato soprattutto incredibili manifestazioni di solidarietà.

 

 

 

Il principale obiettivo del progetto è quello di condividere queste esperienze scientifiche e umane.

È per questo che, dal 27 aprile in poi, ogni settimana, potete guardare un nuovo documentario breve da noi prodotto (qui). Questi filmati costituiranno un’introduzione al fenomeno del pellegrinaggio e dei pellegrinaggi da molteplici punti di vista. Si incentreranno, per esempio, sul ruolo particolare e importante che la luce o il trascorrere del tempo nei luoghi sacri ha per il pellegrino; o, ancora, sull’ideale romantico del Medioevo. Essi daranno un’idea di quella che è la routine quotidiana dei pellegrini, del cibo di cui si nutrono o degli inaspettati colpi di scena che caratterizzano il loro viaggio.

 

Guarda il nostro primo video dedicato ai pellegrinaggi nelle diverse religioni:

 

Abbiamo però bisogno di ulteriori finanziamenti per girare tutti i filmati previsti.

Sceneggiatura, scenografia e riprese video sono a cura degli stessi studenti/pellegrini. Tuttavia, per ottenere filmati di qualità migliore, il team include tecnici del montaggio professionisti e attori di lingua ceca e francese che doppiano i filmati con la loro voce. 

l costo preventivo della loro prestazione è di 6800 dollari. Fino a ora, siamo in grado di coprire le spese dei primi tre filmati, per i quale l’ammontare necessario è di 5100 dollari.

 

 

Uno dei nostri obiettivi più ambiziosi è quello di produrre un libro esclusivo in inglese e francese. In essa pubblicheranno gli studenti insieme con i maggiori esperti a livello mondiale. La grafica del volume sarà affidata agli abili designer del Center for Early Medieval Studies, già responsabili dell’editing di numerosi volumi oggetto di riconoscimenti e premi. 

Per la realizzazione di questo prestigioso volume avremmo bisogno di 2400 dollari per la grafica, 3800 dollari per la revisione degli elaborati degli studenti, nonché di 2000 dollari per il copyright delle illustrazioni, 3200 dollari per i curatori e 9700 dollari per la stampa. I costi verrano in parte coperti dalla Masaryk University, che ci ha già finanziato con 2400 dollari per la stampa del volume. Il Center for Early Medieval Studies coprirà invece i costi della revisione dei testi e della grafica. L’importo totale che desideriamo raggiungere diventa pertanto di 12500 dollari. 

 

 

Se volete saperne di più sui partecipanti guardate il nostro sito web.

It takes a 1500-km route through Switzerland and France, from Lausanne to Mont Saint-Michel. The project aims to take a new look at the medieval heritage of France and Switzerland, from a point of view that a university education doesn’t usually provide. Eleven university students walk along medieval pilgrim routes, with 3-week stops at various important centers of monastic culture: Sainte-Foy de Conques, Saint-Benoît-sur-Loire and Mont-Saint-Michel in Normandy.Our aim is to open the topic of art and medieval pilgrimage to a wider public. Also, we want to bring a new element to university education – the university not only as a place to receive theoretical information, but as a directly experienced practice.Our project was made possible thanks to the support of many people and institutions. At the moment, the Migrating Art Historians have already walked 1,012 km and have completed a three-week stay in the Conques Abbey in southern France, where a one-week course featuring prominent world medievalists (Hans Belting, Sible de Blaauw, Cynthia Hahn) took place. Their lectures are available online for free.  In addition to the interest of scholars and the media, the project has been accompanied by the exceptional generosity of the people the students have met along their journey. They have become acquainted with France, where it is common to accept twelve pilgrims, feed them and offer them beds in the privacy of a home. The media shows us a France affected by an aggressive election campaign of the last weeks. Na jejím obsahu se budou podílet studenti spolu s předními světovými odborníky. Grafického zpracování se ujmou talentovaní designeři působící v Centru raně středověkých studií, pod jejichž rukama vzniklo již několik oceňovaných publikací.Celkové náklady na realizaci takto kvalitní knihy jsou: 2400 $ na grafické zpracování, 1900 $ na jazykové korektury textů studentů, 2000 $ na autorská práva k reprodukcím, 3200 $ na redakci a 9700 $ na tisk.Tyto náklady částečně pokryjeme díky podpoře Masarykovy univerzity, která poskytne částku 2400 $ na tisk knihy. Centrum raně středověkých studií pak zaplatí náklady spojené s korekturami anglických a francouzských textů studentů a s prací grafiků. Částka, kterou bude nutné získat je tedy 12 500 $.   Chcete-li se dozvědět více o všech účastnících pochodu, navštivte naše webové stránky.*** “Migrating Art Historians” in cammino Il progetto "Migrating Art Historians" è un esperimento pedagogico e scientifico, che assume la forma di un pellegrinaggio della durata di 4 mesi. Si svolge lungo 1500 chilometri attraverso la Svizzera e la Francia, da Losanna a Mont Saint-Michel. Il progetto aspira a rivolgere uno sguardo di tipo nuovo sull’eredità artistica medievale di Francia e Svizzera. Un punto di vista che, di norma, la formazione universitaria non offre. Undici studenti universitari camminano lungo le rotte medievali di pellegrinaggio, effettuando soste di 3 settimane in alcuni significativi centri di cultura monastica: Sainte-Foy a Conques, Saint-Benoît-sur-Loire e Mont Saint-Michel in Normandia. Il nostro obiettivo è quello di comunicare a un più vasto pubblico argomenti inerenti all’arte e al pellegrinaggio medievale. Vogliamo inoltre apportare nuovi elementi alla formazione universitaria, intesa non solamente come luogo di apprendimento teorico ma anche quale fulcro di un’esperienza didattica da vivere in prima persona.Il nostro progetto ha potuto vedere la luce grazie al sostegno di tante persone e istituzioni. Al momento, gli Storici dell’Arte Migranti hanno già coperto 1012 chilometri di cammino e hanno terminato un soggiorno di tre settimane nell’abbazia di Conques, in Francia meridionale, dove sarà tenuto un corso di una settimana che vedrà la partecipazione di medievisti di fama mondiale (Hans Belting, Sible de Blaauw, Cynthia Hahn). Le loro lezioni saranno disponibili online gratuitamente.  Oltre all’interesse dimostrato dagli studiosi e dai media, il progetto nel suo insieme è accompagnato dalla eccezionale generosità che gli studenti incontrano durante il loro viaggio. Essi hanno avuto il loro incontro con la Francia, un paese dove è normale accogliere dodici pellegrini, dare loro da mangiare e offrire loro un posto per dormire nella privacy di una casa. I media, nelle ultime settimane, ci hanno mostrano una Francia caratterizzata da una campagna elettorale aggressiva. Ma gli Storici dell’Arte Migranti hanno incontrato soprattutto incredibili manifestazioni di solidarietà.   Il principale obiettivo del progetto è quello di condividere queste esperienze scientifiche e umane.È per questo che, dal 27 aprile in poi, ogni settimana, potete guardare un nuovo documentario breve da noi prodotto (qui). Questi filmati costituiranno un’introduzione al fenomeno del pellegrinaggio e dei pellegrinaggi da molteplici punti di vista. Si incentreranno, per esempio, sul ruolo particolare e importante che la luce o il trascorrere del tempo nei luoghi sacri ha per il pellegrino; o, ancora, sull’ideale romantico del Medioevo. Essi daranno un’idea di quella che è la routine quotidiana dei pellegrini, del cibo di cui si nutrono o degli inaspettati colpi di scena che caratterizzano il loro viaggio. Guarda il nostro primo video dedicato ai pellegrinaggi nelle diverse religioni: Abbiamo però bisogno di ulteriori finanziamenti per girare tutti i filmati previsti.Sceneggiatura, scenografia e riprese video sono a cura degli stessi studenti/pellegrini. Tuttavia, per ottenere filmati di qualità migliore, il team include tecnici del montaggio professionisti e attori di lingua ceca e francese che doppiano i filmati con la loro voce. l costo preventivo della loro prestazione è di 6800 dollari. Fino a ora, siamo in grado di coprire le spese dei primi tre filmati, per i quale l’ammontare necessario è di 5100 dollari.  Uno dei nostri obiettivi più ambiziosi è quello di produrre un libro esclusivo in inglese e francese. In essa pubblicheranno gli studenti insieme con i maggiori esperti a livello mondiale. La grafica del volume sarà affidata agli abili designer del Center for Early Medieval Studies, già responsabili dell’editing di numerosi volumi oggetto di riconoscimenti e premi. Per la realizzazione di questo prestigioso volume avremmo bisogno di 2400 dollari per la grafica, 3800 dollari per la revisione degli elaborati degli studenti, nonché di 2000 dollari per il copyright delle illustrazioni, 3200 dollari per i curatori e 9700 dollari per la stampa. I costi verrano in parte coperti dalla Masaryk University, che ci ha già finanziato con 2400 dollari per la stampa del volume. Il Center for Early Medieval Studies coprirà invece i costi della revisione dei testi e della grafica. L’importo totale che desideriamo raggiungere diventa pertanto di 12500 dollari.   Se volete saperne di più sui partecipanti guardate il nostro sito web.

story:
Short Summary

My goal is to create one million musicians. Music has given me so much and youtube has created a platform for me to share that positivity and energy, but I want to make a real physical connection with people. The idea behind this tour is to visit different ukulele clubs, schools, home-schools, nursing homes, wherever there are people playing the Ukulele and help them learn the instrument and continue to grow both musically and personally. This entire tour will be turned into a documentary as well to help others, who didn't get to experience it first hand, the moral boost they need to go buy an instrument and learn it, something almost everyone has fantasized about at least one time in their lives. 

What We Need & What You Get

I have set my goal at 12,000 USD. The trip is an 7 week trip, which from the research that I have done, with renting a van or RV, will cost a little over 1300 a week for three people. These costs have been estimated based on personal experience of other travelers while considering the following expenses, transportation rental, fuel, propane, sleeping accommodation, food and drink, miscellaneous van supplies, mobile phone, activities and camping and cooking supplies. These costs have been estimated for three people as I will be traveling with two more, a bass player, and a singer/guitar player, both from Medellin, Colombia, were I currently reside. This will further the learning experience with a cultural musical exchange and provide more opportunities for learners to play with a variety of muscians. In addition the two will help me film, and drive, and in general keep the trip safer. These are rental calculations, ideally the indiegogo campaign will raise enough to buy a small work van and convert it into a travel van so this trip can be repeated without the necessity of such a substantial crowdfunding project in the future. This puts the trip at 9000 or so if we rent. I believe with an extra 3000, and the savings from the rent, a serviceable work van can be bought, which would be the ideal scenario, bringing the total to 12000. Any extra money will go directly to the project in terms of extra strings, picks and other musical equipment, such as amps or cables in addition to cameras and/or microphones to help with the documentary, lighting or other cultural opportunities. 

What perks do you get for participating? 

10 dollar donations will get their name in the credits of the final documentary that will be made about the trip. 

50 dollar donations will get their name in the credits of the weekly videos produced on the road as well. 

100 donations will get their name painted on the van on "Door of Gratitude," as well as all previous benefits.

350 dollar donations will get you all the previous benefits, as well as choosing a song for us to cover and make a video of dedicated to you on the trip as well. 

500 dollar donations will receive a hand signed Ukulele thanking them for the contribution they made in helping us create 1,000,000 muscians. 

What happens to the money if we don't reach the goal?

The most important item is the van, if that is the only thing I am able afford is a van or RV rental, I will find a way to finance the rest of the trip. If I do not raise enough to buy a van, I will rent one, I am determined to do this, I see the benefits, I am passionate about it, I will help people learn how to play an instrument. I believe the time is now to do this project and I believe in the positive impact that it will have.   

The Impact

Eduction, as it pertains to art and music in the United States is in trouble. People are forgetting why it is so important, it is my goal to help remind them, to introduce music to a new generation and to help an older generation re-fall in love with their songs. The biggest impact will be with the people that we will directly teach, they will be the ones that will have the chance to put their hands on an instrument, ask questions, and feed their curiosity, but the impact is not limited to them. By documenting the process people will have a chance to show their communities the value of art and music education and use it as a tool to inspire local communities to invest in education. Additionally our youtube channel currently has over 450 free educational videos for people to learn. By documenting this process we will be reaching a larger demographic then we currently are, which are primarily music learners. We would like to reach a larger audience, or what I call "potential learners" which we are hoping to inspire to pick up an instrument as well, and if they chose to do so, they will have access the free education that we currently provide. 

This is something I am looking to repeat, I will not be able to see the USA in one trip, but I may be able to see a large portion and buy purchasing a van I will be able to see another large portion and repeat the process at a later date, which some day I would like to repeat through Central and South America as well. That will be more likely if I am able to purchase the van as opposed to rent it, but we have to eat an elephant one bite at a time and it starts with this tour. 

Risks & Challenges

The largest challenge I see is gathering enough people to reach my goal of 50 students a week . To address that challenge I am currently working with my social networks to help locate ukulele clubs and small schools or groups of home schools that would be interested in participating in this education. I am confident through preperation and dialouge this problem can be avoided quite easily. 

Other Ways You Can Help

All help is welcome and money isn't the only help! Other ways you can get involved. 

  • Old instrument in the house that you don't play anymore? Any instrument you want to donate will be passed on to a perspective student. 
  • Know a school, church, homeschool or Ukulele club that wants to a do an Ukulele learning seminar? Seminars range from "what the heck is this thing?!?" to how to play with other bands, basic and advanced blues techniques, strumming techniques, easy through advanced songs, and everything in between. These can be catered to the learners needs. 
  • Got a van? I know someone that needs one!
  • Share the campaign on your social media, help us get the word out.
  • Try Indiegogo share tools, that great for just that.

story:
Hello, we are a group of University of Tennessee students working with the non-profit organization, The Joy of Music School, to provide the financially disadvantaged youth of East Tennessee with the opportunity to learn how to read and play music, and to improve their lives through the art and discipline of music. 

The school provides a free service where students attend music lessons once every week.  The Joy of Music School uses a star system to motivate their students to practice and be polite. They earn stars for arriving to their lessons on time, being polite and respectful to their teacher, and showing that they have practiced since their last lesson. Once they accumulate enough stars, then the students can trade them in for prizes, which are on display in their lobby. (We must add that the prizes are pretty awesome!)

The Joy of Music School serves over two hundred financially disadvantaged, at-risk children and teens from around the greater Knoxville area. If a child you know would like to join the school or if you would like to know more information about the qualification process for students, click How to Apply link at the bottom of this page. Admission to the school is contingent upon the same household income requirements as the Federal Free/Reduced Lunch Program in public schools.

Francis Graffeo, who has been with the school since 2005, is the Executive Director of The Joy of Music School.  All of the teachers at the school are volunteers who share their musical knowledge. To learn more about the faculty and staff, click the link at the bottom of this page labeled About Us to visit The Joy of Music School website.

Our group, The Melody of Joy Group, values local youth, music, and helping out the community.  We need the help of supporters like you to fund our campaign!

The Joy of Music School has communicated to us that they need several things including new microphones, new instruments for the kids, and new recording devices. We intend to help provide these items for them with your help! Non-monetary donations are also accepted but must first be approved by the school.

Those who donate can receive some thank-you gifts based upon the dollar amount donated. Those who donate five dollars will receive golf tees and small trinkets from sponsors of The Joy of Music School. Those who donate $20 or more dollars to our cause will receive a Joy of Music School engraved holiday ornament. The Melody of Joy Group will ship these items to you, free of charge.

To stay up to date on our current fundraising efforts, visit our blog https://themelodyofjoyblog.wordpress.com/ where we will be posting dates of when we will be on The University of Tennessee Knoxville  campus  to accept donations as well as general information about our campaign.

Thank you so much for your support of this life-changing program!

How to Apply: http://www.joyofmusicschool.org/index.php/how-to-apply/

About Us: http://www.joyofmusicschool.org/index.php/about-us/
