story:
What we believe

We know communication is important to fulfill any activity in life, but what would happen if someone uses a different way to communicate? Do we ignore them?

We're convinced that being able to understand each other is important. That’s why we consider learning sign language to be of great help when breaking communication barriers between people with hearing impairment and those who only use verbal communication.



Why is Kitsord different from the rest?

It’s a platform where you'll be able to learn sign language for your specific country for free. You'll be able to learn through dynamic games that make it easy and fun to learn.

We want sign language to be an important part of society’s way to communicate. We offer the opportunity to interact with people who might feel discriminated for communicating exclusively through sign language. We want to be part of their world.



Getting the best from Kitsord

We have been working on many new features for the current platform, making the experience of learning sign language much cooler than before.

We’ll be including new challenges, a new way to keep record of your performance, variety of languages, a whole new interface, and plenty more features that will enhance the experience.




Making it count

Your help is really important to us because it will help boost the project to break those communication barriers.

Up to now, team members have been working on the project by their own means. However, we have reached a point where we need your valuable support to improve and expand the knowledge of sign language.

Your cooperation will help us pay for:




Step by Step




If we all got together

More than 35,000 people are learning sign language with Kitsord. If we all got together, it would take less than $1.50 each to reach our goal. Do the math!




Meet the team

We’re the team behind Kitsord. Our dream is to see everyone learning sign language, and we want to be part of that change through our platform. Each one of us have contributed efforts in this project because we know Kitsord has the potential to pop those isolation bubbles that keep people with hearing impairment distant to others. 



FAQ      

1. Is it free?

That's right! You'll be able to access the platform through the website, your Android or iOS device. This will have no cost, and everything you need to learn the basics will be included.

2. Will it be available for all devices?

We will be renewing the Android app, creating the iOS app, and making it accessible through our  website.

3. Can I learn and access more than one language?

Totally! You can learn sign language for the countries included in the platform.

4. Will the content on the platform be free?

Right! The content to learn the basics will be totally free. You will have enough challenges to keep you learning.

5. Is sign language different for every country?

Exactly. Each country has its own signs. It's possible that some have adopted signs from others, but there will always be words that differ in their signs.

6. Will the lessons in the platform have a cost?

No, we're not creating more barriers to keep you from learning the basics of sign language. However, we will be including extra content for all those who want to expand their horizons in learning; these will have a very low price.

P.S. If you want to be the sponsor for a specific language, and this one isn't in the perks, please contact us through this platform, our social media pages or our website. We will be glad to help you.

story:
Versão em PORTUGUÊS disponível abaixo
Versión ESPAÑOL abajo

 

ENGLISH

 

Who is Mongó?

We’re Pato from Argentina, a musician, teacher and dreamer. Vini from Brazil, an engineer who loves nature and teaching. And Jaime from Spain, a McGyver craftman-designer. Our destinies met when we were all traveling in New Zealand - and here we are turning our dream into reality together!

Today we share the same profession: we are "Musical Park" makers. We travel to schools or orphanages to build creative, fun and interdisciplinary spaces together with the kids their communities. We create an outdoor space for learning while integrating with nature.

"What?"

Wait… let us tell you our purspose:

When we were traveling around the world we realised our planet needs help! We saw that a way to help was to learn how to communicate better with each other and to learn again how to use our natural resources. We saw that our children need a new approach on education. For these reasons, we have a new approach which proposes:

1. What?
An experiential and exploratory education. 

2. Where?
With wide spaces, without tables or chairs to limit the learning experience. Flexible outdoor spaces, surrounded by nature.

3. How?
Focused to facilitate liberating experiences that connect ourselves to our emotions. Focused also on improving the communication in all its aspects, with one’s self, with our peers and within our communities.

"I still don't quite get it..."

What do we do?

In simple terms, our mission is to facilitate the creation of sustainable, outdoor, creative, fun spaces, surrounded by nature. These spaces will be called Musical Parks!

"And what is a Musical Park?"

It’s an interdisciplinary classroom, a concert hall, a vegetable garden, an outdoor lab and above all a meeting point for the whole community. Amazing, isn't it?

And the next step is to build

our first Musical Park! 

Guess where? In Africa!

Yes! We were invited to build at NGO Caring Africa's orphanage, in Moshi, a small town by the base of Mt. Kilimanjaro in Tanzania. We’ll stay for three months in total to complete the project and run workshops for the kids. It’s an incredible Project that give children a new opportunity through music and art.

 

"Now I get it! But how do you do this?"

 

The project has 3 key phases:

OBSERVING, SKETCHING AND HANDS-ON!

(Duration: 1 month)

Observing: This phase involves observing and gathering information on local environment, the community and the children needs.

Sketching: The kids are the artists and the designers, and they will create and plan the Musical Park based on permaculture concepts that we’ll share.

Hands-on: We love to get our hands dirty with earth. We’ll start planting vegetables, flowers and medicinal plants, maintaining the local culture and resources.

COLLECTION AND BUILDING!

(Duration: 1 month)

Colletion: With our plan ready we start collecting rubbish and reciclables to create our musical instruments.

Building: Pure fun and musical learning while we use creativity to explore the world of sounds through the musical instruments crafting!

PLAY!

(Duration: 1 month)

Yes! This is the most important part, so and we reserve a whole month to use this newly created space for workshops, to learn, to have fun, to teach traditional subjects as well as other subjects such as communication, free expression, critical thinking, self-knowledge and community values!

 

What do we leave in Tanzania apart from the Musical Park?

  • The experience of building with rubbish (Upcycling) and learning about permaculture building techniques.
  • The artistic and musical experience. The games, dances and music!
  • All the tools used to make the instruments and the Musical Park’s structure.
  • All teaching materials about recycling, gardening, building and how to use the Musical Park as a teaching space.

 

Share with your friends!

 

ESPAÑOL

 

¿Quién es Mongó?

¡Hola! Somos Pato, de argentina, músico-educadora y soñadora, Vini, brasileño, ingeniero que adora la naturaleza y enseñar, y Jaime español, diseñador, artesano, y “Mcgyver” en las horas libres. Nos conocemos desde que empezamos a viajar por el mundo.

Hoy te contamos sobre nuestra nueva profesión: constructores de Parques Musicales. Vamos a escuelas y orfanatos, y junto a los niños y maestros, construimos un espacio interdisciplinario, creativo y divertido donde todos pueden salir del aula e integrarse con la naturaleza mientras aprenden.

"¿Cómo es?"

…Te explicamos primero nuestro “Por qué”:

¡Viajando vimos que nuestro planeta necesita ayuda URGENTE! Vimos que necesitamos reaprender a comunicarnos y a usar nuestros recursos naturales. Vimos que los niños necesitan una nueva forma de aprender. Por eso, al recordar la forma en que fuimos educados, creamos una nueva propuesta:

1. ¿Qué?
Una educación basada en la exploración práctica.

2. ¿Dónde?
En espacios amplios que no limitan el aprendizaje. Espacios flexibles, sin sillas ni mesas. Al aire libre y en medio de la naturaleza.

3. ¿Cómo?
Enfocado en crear experiencias que nos liberen, nos conecten con nuestras emociones, enfatizando la comunicación sana consigo mismo, con sus pares y con el entorno.

"Todavía no entendí ..."

¿Cuál es nuestra propuesta?

De forma súper simple, nuestra misión es facilitar  la creación de espacios de enseñanza sostenibles, creativos, divertidos, al aire libre y en medio de la naturaleza. ¡Todo eso formará lo que llamamos Parque Musical!

"¿Y qué es un Parque Musical?"

Es una sala de múltiples disciplinas, un auditorio musical, un jardín, un laboratorio al aire libre y un punto de encuentro para la comunidad. Genial no ?!

¡Y ahora vamos a construir
el primer Parque Musical!

¿Adivinas dónde? ¡En África!

¡Pues SI!
Nos invitaron a construir un parque en un orfanato de la ONG Caring Africa en Moshi, un pueblo en los pies del Monte Kilimanjaro, en Tanzania, donde nos quedaremos 3 meses en total! Es un proyecto increíble que acoge a niños huérfanos y dan una nueva oportunidad a través de la música y el arte.

 

"Ok! ¡Ahora entendí! Pero, ¿cómo se hará todo esto?"

 

Dividimos nuestro proyecto en algunas etapas:

¡INVESTIGACIÓN, DISEÑO Y MANOS A LA OBRA!

(Duración: 1 mes)

Investigación y preparación: En esta etapa vamos a observar la naturaleza y las necesidades de aquellos niños y comunidad.

Diseño: Aquí los niños son los artistas y diseñadores. Dibujarán y planificarán el Parque con conceptos naturales.

Manos a la obra: Adoramos ensuciar nuestras manos con tierra. Así, iniciaremos la siembra de vegetales, flores y plantas medicinales, valorizando los recursos y la cultura local.

¡RECOLECCIÓN, CONSTRUCCIÓN!

(Duración: 1 mes)

Recolección: Con el diseño en las manos, partimos para la recolección de basura y materiales reciclables para crear los instrumentos musicales.

Construcción: Pura diversión y aprendizaje musical mientras usamos la creatividad para explorar el mundo de los sonidos!

¡JUGAR!

(Duración: 1 mes)

¡Sí! ¡Eso es lo más importante y por eso reservamos 1 mes entero para usar el Parque como el nuevo espacio para aprender divirtiéndose. Y ese espacio será el aula al aire libre para explorar todas las áreas de aprendizaje tanto las materias tradicionales como la comunicación, libertad, pensamiento crítico, autoconocimiento, comunidad.

 

¿Y qué vamos a dejar en Tanzania?

  • El aula natural en forma de Parque Musical
  • Toda la experiencia y nuevas ideas para construir con materiales reciclados y con conceptos de bioconstrucción.
  • La vivencia artística y musical con muchos juegos, danzas y músicas.
  • Todas las herramientas que usamos para construir el Parque.
  • Herramientas didácticas sobre uso del Parque Musical como espacio de aprendizaje.

 

 

¡Difunde con tus amigos!

 

 

PORTUGUÊS

 

Quem é Mongó?

Olá! Somos Pato, argentina músico-educadora e sonhadora, Vini, brasileiro engenheiro do mato que adora ensinar, e Jaime, designer-artesão español e Mcgyver nas horas vagas. Nos conhecemos desde que começamos a viajar pelo mundo.

Hoje vamos te contar sobre nossa nova profissão: construtores de Parques Musicais. Nós vamos até escolas e orfanatos, e junto com as crianças e professores, construimos um espaço interdisciplinar, criativo e divertido onde todos podem sair da sala de aula e integrar com a natureza enquanto aprendem.

"Como é que é?"

Calma… Te explicamos primeiro o nosso porquê:

Viajando vimos que nosso planeta precisa de ajuda URGENTE! Vimos que necessitamos de reaprender a nos comunicar e a usar nossos recursos naturais. Vimos que nossas crianças precisam de uma nova forma de aprender. Por isso, ao lembrar da forma como nós fomos educados, criamos uma nova proposta:

1. Qual?
Uma educação baseada na exploração prática.

2. Onde?
Em espaços amplos que não limitem o aprendizado. Espaços flexíveis, sem cadeiras e mesas. Ao ar livre e em meio a natureza.

3. Como?
Focada em criar experiências que nos liberem, nos conectem com as nossas emoções, enfatizando a comunicação saudável consigo, com seus pares e com a sua comunidade.

"Ainda não entendi..."

Qual é a nossa proposta?

De forma super simples, nossa missão é facilitar a criação de espaços de ensino sustentáveis, criativos, divertidos, ao ar livre e em meio a natureza. Isso tudo formará o que chamamos de Parque Musical!

"E o que é um Parque Musical?"

É uma sala de aula de múltiplas disciplinas, um auditório musical, um jardim, um laboratorio ao ar livre e um ponto de encontro para a comunidade.

Genial, né?!

E agora vamos construir o primeiro

Parque Musical!

Adivinha onde? Na África!

Pois é! Nos convidaram para construir em um orfanato da ONG Caring Africa em Moshi, uma cidadezinha nos pés do Monte Kilimanjaro, na Tanzania, onde no total vamos ficar 3 meses!  É um projeto incrível que acolhe crianças órfãs e dão uma nova oportunidade através da música e da arte. 

 

"E como tudo isso será feito?"

 

Dividimos nosso projeto em três etapas:

BUSCA, DESENHO E MÃO NA MASSA!

(Duração: 1 mês)

Busca: Nessa etapa vamos observar a natureza e as necessidades daquelas crianças e da comunidade em que vivem.

Desenho: Aqui as crianças são os artistas e designers. Assim vão desenhar e planejar o Parque com conceitos naturais.

Mãos na massa: Adoramos sujar nossas mãos de terra. Assim, iniciaremos o plantio de vegetais, flores e plantas medicinais, valorizando os recursos e a cultura local.

COLETA, CONSTRUÇÃO!

(Duração: 1 mês)

Coleta: Com o desenho em mãos, partimos para a coleta de lixo e materiais recicláveis para criar os instrumentos musicais.

Construção: Pura diversão e aprendizado musical enquanto usamos a criatividade para explorar o mundo dos sons!

BRINCAR!

(Duração: 1 mês)

Sim! Isso é o mais importante e por isso reservamos 1 mês inteiro para usar todo o Parque como a nova sala de aula, para aprender divertindo-se tanto as matérias tradicionais como a comunicação, liberdade, pensamento crítico, autoconhecimento e comunidade!

 

E o que vamos deixar na Tanzânia?

  • Toda a experiência e novas ideias de construir com materiais reciclados e com conceitos de  bio-construção.
  • A vivência artística e musical com muitas brincadeiras, danças e músicas.
  • Todas as ferramentas que usamos para construir.
  • Ferramentas didáticas sobre o uso do Parque como um espaço de aprendizagem.

 

 

Compartilhe com seus amigos!

story:
Hi everyone,

This holiday season, we hope you consider giving the gift of a brighter future to a group of high-potential students from underserved communities in Minnesota. With your help, we can empower them to pursue their dreams of careers in tech.

Every year, our non-profit Silicon North Stars brings 16 eighth-graders out to Silicon Valley for a one-week tech camp. They tour major tech companies and learn the basics of entrepreneurship - so that they can enter high school with a vision for their future and a strong belief that they can achieve their dreams. 

We're raising $5,000 in our holiday campaign to ensure these kids can participate in our program cost-free. This is our 6th year of Silicon North Stars. By the end of this campaign we'll have brought over 95 different students into the program.

 

What is the challenge we're trying to solve?

For kids who come from underserved communities, imagining a career in technology can be tough. Role models are hard to find, and there’s no clear path to success in front of them. Yet at the same time, the tech industry desperately needs to diversify its workforce - studies show that the more diverse a company is, the better products it creates and the happier its workforce becomes. Talent is universal, but access to opportunity is not.

That’s where Silicon North Stars comes in. Each year, we take 16 students from underrepresented communities in Minnesota’s Twin Cities and bring them to California's Silicon Valley for a unique, one-week technology camp. They visit the campuses and meet with professionals from some of the world's most successful tech companies (Google, Facebook, YouTube, etc.), set goals during a career counseling session, and then create and pitch their own startup ideas to the Silicon Valley tech community. When they return to Minnesota, they engage in a series of regular "Minnesota Meetups" to connect with the Twin Cities tech community and stay connected to each other and the goals that they set on the trip. We're building a community that we believe will build the future of the tech community in Minnesota - and strengthen connections between the Midwest and Silicon Valley.

Students hear from SNS board member R.T. Rybak at our Minnesota Demo Day!

 

Why Minnesota?

We were both born in the Midwest, and Steve grew up in Minnesota. We've recently moved to Minneapolis from Silicon Valley, and are passionate about building the tech ecosystem here!

We’ve run Silicon North Stars for five years so far, and the students we’ve gotten to meet have been outstanding. Intelligent, curious, and courageous, they come from a variety of humble backgrounds and all share an interest in technology. They leave the camp experience inspired, and the Minnesota Meetups are great ways to keep that inspiration going.

 

What does this all cost?

Our annual operating costs are $75,000. This includes all operational costs for the organization, travel, accommodations, and Minnesota-based programming. We’re firmly committed to offering membership 100% free to every student. 

You can find out more about us at www.siliconnorthstars.org.

We truly appreciate your support!

 

With Gratitude,

Mary and Steve Grove

Co-founders of Silicon North Stars

They leave the camp experience inspired, and the Minnesota Meetups are great ways to keep that inspiration going.
 
What does this all cost?
Our annual operating costs are $75,000. This includes all operational costs for the organization, travel, accommodations, and Minnesota-based programming. We’re firmly committed to offering membership 100% free to every student. 
You can find out more about us at www.siliconnorthstars.org.
We truly appreciate your support!
 
With Gratitude,
Mary and Steve Grove
Co-founders of Silicon North Stars

story:
O que é

Realizada em Mountain View, a Brazil at Silicon Valley é uma conferência anual sem fins-lucrativos organizado por estudantes brasileiros de Stanford e de UC Berkeley. A 2ª edição ocorrerá nos dias 30 e 31 de Março de 2020 e ano passado fomos +750 presentes, +60 palestrantes e 80 estudantes/professores que compartilharam experiências, conhecimentos e principalmente ambições de transformar o Brasil.

Por que incentivar estudantes na Brazil Sillicon Valey?

Segundo a consultoria McKinsey & Company, o nível de produtividade do Brasil cresceu pouco nos últimos anos e precisa solucionar desafios de inovação e de produtividade:

Nossa missão

  • Conectar o Brasil ao Vale do Silício
  • Transformar o futuro através da tecnologia e inovação
  • Incentivar uma mentalidade empreendedora com atuais e futuros líderes

Nosso desafio

  • Selecionar líderes futuros do país
  • Diversificar público de estudantes
  • Prover recursos necessários para 50 estudantes participarem na conferência

Em parceria com a Fundação Estudar, selecionaremos 50 estudantes brasileiros de alto potencial para participarem da conferência

Como o dinheiro será gasto?

Todo dinheiro arrecadado será convertido para custear estudantes que necessitam de ajuda de custo para participarem da conferência.
